45/* ======================== Sentinel global state =========================== */
46
47/* Address object, used to describe an ip:port pair. */
48typedef struct sentinelAddr {
49 char *ip;
50 int port;
51} sentinelAddr;
52
53/* A Sentinel Redis Instance object is monitoring. */
54#define SRI_MASTER (1<<0)
55#define SRI_SLAVE (1<<1)
56#define SRI_SENTINEL (1<<2)
57#define SRI_DISCONNECTED (1<<3)
58#define SRI_S_DOWN (1<<4) /* Subjectively down (no quorum). */
59#define SRI_O_DOWN (1<<5) /* Objectively down (confirmed by others). */
60#define SRI_MASTER_DOWN (1<<6) /* A Sentinel with this flag set thinks that
61 its master is down. */
62#define SRI_FAILOVER_IN_PROGRESS (1<<7) /* Failover is in progress for
63 this master. */
64#define SRI_PROMOTED (1<<8) /* Slave selected for promotion. */
65#define SRI_RECONF_SENT (1<<9) /* SLAVEOF <newmaster> sent. */
66#define SRI_RECONF_INPROG (1<<10) /* Slave synchronization in progress. */
67#define SRI_RECONF_DONE (1<<11) /* Slave synchronized with new master. */
68#define SRI_FORCE_FAILOVER (1<<12) /* Force failover with master up. */
69#define SRI_SCRIPT_KILL_SENT (1<<13) /* SCRIPT KILL already sent on -BUSY */
70
71/* Note: times are in milliseconds. */
72#define SENTINEL_INFO_PERIOD 10000
73#define SENTINEL_PING_PERIOD 1000
74#define SENTINEL_ASK_PERIOD 1000
75#define SENTINEL_PUBLISH_PERIOD 2000
76#define SENTINEL_DEFAULT_DOWN_AFTER 30000
77#define SENTINEL_HELLO_CHANNEL "__sentinel__:hello"
78#define SENTINEL_TILT_TRIGGER 2000
79#define SENTINEL_TILT_PERIOD (SENTINEL_PING_PERIOD*30)
80#define SENTINEL_DEFAULT_SLAVE_PRIORITY 100
81#define SENTINEL_SLAVE_RECONF_TIMEOUT 10000
82#define SENTINEL_DEFAULT_PARALLEL_SYNCS 1
83#define SENTINEL_MIN_LINK_RECONNECT_PERIOD 15000
84#define SENTINEL_DEFAULT_FAILOVER_TIMEOUT (60*3*1000)
85#define SENTINEL_MAX_PENDING_COMMANDS 100
86#define SENTINEL_ELECTION_TIMEOUT 10000
87#define SENTINEL_MAX_DESYNC 1000
88
89/* Failover machine different states. */
90#define SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_NONE 0 /* No failover in progress. */
91#define SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_WAIT_START 1 /* Wait for failover_start_time*/
92#define SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_SELECT_SLAVE 2 /* Select slave to promote */
93#define SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_SEND_SLAVEOF_NOONE 3 /* Slave -> Master */
94#define SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_WAIT_PROMOTION 4 /* Wait slave to change role */
95#define SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_RECONF_SLAVES 5 /* SLAVEOF newmaster */
96#define SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_UPDATE_CONFIG 6 /* Monitor promoted slave. */
97
98#define SENTINEL_MASTER_LINK_STATUS_UP 0
99#define SENTINEL_MASTER_LINK_STATUS_DOWN 1
100
101/* Generic flags that can be used with different functions.
102 * They use higher bits to avoid colliding with the function specific
103 * flags. */
104#define SENTINEL_NO_FLAGS 0
105#define SENTINEL_GENERATE_EVENT (1<<16)
106#define SENTINEL_LEADER (1<<17)
107#define SENTINEL_OBSERVER (1<<18)
108
109/* Script execution flags and limits. */
110#define SENTINEL_SCRIPT_NONE 0
111#define SENTINEL_SCRIPT_RUNNING 1
112#define SENTINEL_SCRIPT_MAX_QUEUE 256
113#define SENTINEL_SCRIPT_MAX_RUNNING 16
114#define SENTINEL_SCRIPT_MAX_RUNTIME 60000 /* 60 seconds max exec time. */
115#define SENTINEL_SCRIPT_MAX_RETRY 10
116#define SENTINEL_SCRIPT_RETRY_DELAY 30000 /* 30 seconds between retries. */
117
118typedef struct sentinelRedisInstance {
119 int flags; /* See SRI_... defines */
120 char *name; /* Master name from the point of view of this sentinel. */
121 char *runid; /* run ID of this instance. */
122 uint64_t config_epoch; /* Configuration epoch. */
123 sentinelAddr *addr; /* Master host. */
124 redisAsyncContext *cc; /* Hiredis context for commands. */
125 redisAsyncContext *pc; /* Hiredis context for Pub / Sub. */
126 int pending_commands; /* Number of commands sent waiting for a reply. */
127 mstime_t cc_conn_time; /* cc connection time. */
128 mstime_t pc_conn_time; /* pc connection time. */
129 mstime_t pc_last_activity; /* Last time we received any message. */
130 mstime_t last_avail_time; /* Last time the instance replied to ping with
131 a reply we consider valid. */
132 mstime_t last_ping_time; /* Last time a pending ping was sent in the
133 context of the current command connection
134 with the instance. 0 if still not sent or
135 if pong already received. */
136 mstime_t last_pong_time; /* Last time the instance replied to ping,
137 whatever the reply was. That's used to check
138 if the link is idle and must be reconnected. */
139 mstime_t last_pub_time; /* Last time we sent hello via Pub/Sub. */
140 mstime_t last_hello_time; /* Only used if SRI_SENTINEL is set. Last time
141 we received a hello from this Sentinel
142 via Pub/Sub. */
143 mstime_t last_master_down_reply_time; /* Time of last reply to
144 SENTINEL is-master-down command. */
145 mstime_t s_down_since_time; /* Subjectively down since time. */
146 mstime_t o_down_since_time; /* Objectively down since time. */
147 mstime_t down_after_period; /* Consider it down after that period. */
148 mstime_t info_refresh; /* Time at which we received INFO output from it. */
149
150 /* Role and the first time we observed it.
151 * This is useful in order to delay replacing what the instance reports
152 * with our own configuration. We need to always wait some time in order
153 * to give a chance to the leader to report the new configuration before
154 * we do silly things. */
155 int role_reported;
156 mstime_t role_reported_time;
157 mstime_t slave_conf_change_time; /* Last time slave master addr changed. */
158
159 /* Master specific. */
160 dict *sentinels; /* Other sentinels monitoring the same master. */
161 dict *slaves; /* Slaves for this master instance. */
162 unsigned int quorum;/* Number of sentinels that need to agree on failure. */
163 int parallel_syncs; /* How many slaves to reconfigure at same time. */
164 char *auth_pass; /* Password to use for AUTH against master & slaves. */
165
166 /* Slave specific. */
167 mstime_t master_link_down_time; /* Slave replication link down time. */
168 int slave_priority; /* Slave priority according to its INFO output. */
169 mstime_t slave_reconf_sent_time; /* Time at which we sent SLAVE OF <new> */
170 struct sentinelRedisInstance *master; /* Master instance if it's slave. */
171 char *slave_master_host; /* Master host as reported by INFO */
172 int slave_master_port; /* Master port as reported by INFO */
173 int slave_master_link_status; /* Master link status as reported by INFO */
174 unsigned long long slave_repl_offset; /* Slave replication offset. */
175 /* Failover */
176 char *leader; /* If this is a master instance, this is the runid of
177 the Sentinel that should perform the failover. If
178 this is a Sentinel, this is the runid of the Sentinel
179 that this Sentinel voted as leader. */
180 uint64_t leader_epoch; /* Epoch of the 'leader' field. */
181 uint64_t failover_epoch; /* Epoch of the currently started failover. */
182 int failover_state; /* See SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_* defines. */
183 mstime_t failover_state_change_time;
184 mstime_t failover_start_time; /* Last failover attempt start time. */
185 mstime_t failover_timeout; /* Max time to refresh failover state. */
186 mstime_t failover_delay_logged; /* For what failover_start_time value we
187 logged the failover delay. */
188 struct sentinelRedisInstance *promoted_slave; /* Promoted slave instance. */
189 /* Scripts executed to notify admin or reconfigure clients: when they
190 * are set to NULL no script is executed. */
191 char *notification_script;
192 char *client_reconfig_script;
193} sentinelRedisInstance;
194
195/* Main state. */
196struct sentinelState {
197 uint64_t current_epoch; /* Current epoch. */
198 dict *masters; /* Dictionary of master sentinelRedisInstances.
199 Key is the instance name, value is the
200 sentinelRedisInstance structure pointer. */
201 int tilt; /* Are we in TILT mode? */
202 int running_scripts; /* Number of scripts in execution right now. */
203 mstime_t tilt_start_time; /* When TITL started. */
204 mstime_t previous_time; /* Last time we ran the time handler. */
205 list *scripts_queue; /* Queue of user scripts to execute. */
206 char *announce_ip; /* IP addr that is gossiped to other sentinels if
207 not NULL. */
208 int announce_port; /* Port that is gossiped to other sentinels if
209 non zero. */
210} sentinel;
211
212/* A script execution job. */
213typedef struct sentinelScriptJob {
214 int flags; /* Script job flags: SENTINEL_SCRIPT_* */
215 int retry_num; /* Number of times we tried to execute it. */
216 char **argv; /* Arguments to call the script. */
217 mstime_t start_time; /* Script execution time if the script is running,
218 otherwise 0 if we are allowed to retry the
219 execution at any time. If the script is not
220 running and it's not 0, it means: do not run
221 before the specified time. */
222 pid_t pid; /* Script execution pid. */
223} sentinelScriptJob;
224
225/* ======================= hiredis ae.c adapters =============================
226 * Note: this implementation is taken from hiredis/adapters/ae.h, however
227 * we have our modified copy for Sentinel in order to use our allocator
228 * and to have full control over how the adapter works. */
229
230typedef struct redisAeEvents {
231 redisAsyncContext *context;
232 aeEventLoop *loop;
233 int fd;
234 int reading, writing;
235} redisAeEvents;
236
237static void redisAeReadEvent(aeEventLoop *el, int fd, void *privdata, int mask) {
238 ((void)el); ((void)fd); ((void)mask);
239
240 redisAeEvents *e = (redisAeEvents*)privdata;
241 redisAsyncHandleRead(e->context);
242}
243
244static void redisAeWriteEvent(aeEventLoop *el, int fd, void *privdata, int mask) {
245 ((void)el); ((void)fd); ((void)mask);
246
247 redisAeEvents *e = (redisAeEvents*)privdata;
248 redisAsyncHandleWrite(e->context);
249}
250
251static void redisAeAddRead(void *privdata) {
252 redisAeEvents *e = (redisAeEvents*)privdata;
253 aeEventLoop *loop = e->loop;
254 if (!e->reading) {
255 e->reading = 1;
256 aeCreateFileEvent(loop,e->fd,AE_READABLE,redisAeReadEvent,e);
257 }
258}
259
260static void redisAeDelRead(void *privdata) {
261 redisAeEvents *e = (redisAeEvents*)privdata;
262 aeEventLoop *loop = e->loop;
263 if (e->reading) {
264 e->reading = 0;
265 aeDeleteFileEvent(loop,e->fd,AE_READABLE);
266 }
267}
268
269static void redisAeAddWrite(void *privdata) {
270 redisAeEvents *e = (redisAeEvents*)privdata;
271 aeEventLoop *loop = e->loop;
272 if (!e->writing) {
273 e->writing = 1;
274 aeCreateFileEvent(loop,e->fd,AE_WRITABLE,redisAeWriteEvent,e);
275 }
276}
277
278static void redisAeDelWrite(void *privdata) {
279 redisAeEvents *e = (redisAeEvents*)privdata;
280 aeEventLoop *loop = e->loop;
281 if (e->writing) {
282 e->writing = 0;
283 aeDeleteFileEvent(loop,e->fd,AE_WRITABLE);
284 }
285}
286
287static void redisAeCleanup(void *privdata) {
288 redisAeEvents *e = (redisAeEvents*)privdata;
289 redisAeDelRead(privdata);
290 redisAeDelWrite(privdata);
291 zfree(e);
292}
293
294static int redisAeAttach(aeEventLoop *loop, redisAsyncContext *ac) {
295 redisContext *c = &(ac->c);
296 redisAeEvents *e;
297
298 /* Nothing should be attached when something is already attached */
299 if (ac->ev.data != NULL)
300 return REDIS_ERR;
301
302 /* Create container for context and r/w events */
303 e = (redisAeEvents*)zmalloc(sizeof(*e));
304 e->context = ac;
305 e->loop = loop;
306 e->fd = c->fd;
307 e->reading = e->writing = 0;
308
309 /* Register functions to start/stop listening for events */
310 ac->ev.addRead = redisAeAddRead;
311 ac->ev.delRead = redisAeDelRead;
312 ac->ev.addWrite = redisAeAddWrite;
313 ac->ev.delWrite = redisAeDelWrite;
314 ac->ev.cleanup = redisAeCleanup;
315 ac->ev.data = e;
316
317 return REDIS_OK;
318}

347unsigned int dictSdsHash(const void *key);

351void dictInstancesValDestructor (void *privdata, void *obj) {

353 releaseSentinelRedisInstance(obj);
354}

356/* Instance name (sds) -> instance (sentinelRedisInstance pointer)
357 *
358 * also used for: sentinelRedisInstance->sentinels dictionary that maps
359 * sentinels ip:port to last seen time in Pub/Sub hello message. */
360dictType instancesDictType = {
361 dictSdsHash, /* hash function */
362 NULL, /* key dup */
363 NULL, /* val dup */
364 dictSdsKeyCompare, /* key compare */
365 NULL, /* key destructor */
366 dictInstancesValDestructor /* val destructor */
367};
368
369/* Instance runid (sds) -> votes (long casted to void*)
370 *
371 * This is useful into sentinelGetObjectiveLeader() function in order to
372 * count the votes and understand who is the leader. */
373dictType leaderVotesDictType = {
374 dictSdsHash, /* hash function */
375 NULL, /* key dup */
376 NULL, /* val dup */
377 dictSdsKeyCompare, /* key compare */
378 NULL, /* key destructor */
379 NULL /* val destructor */
380};

382/* =========================== Initialization =============================== */
383
384void sentinelCommand(redisClient *c);
385void sentinelInfoCommand(redisClient *c);
386void sentinelSetCommand(redisClient *c);
387void sentinelPublishCommand(redisClient *c);
388void sentinelRoleCommand(redisClient *c);
389
390struct redisCommand sentinelcmds[] = {
391 {"ping",pingCommand,1,"",0,NULL,0,0,0,0,0},
392 {"sentinel",sentinelCommand,-2,"",0,NULL,0,0,0,0,0},
393 {"subscribe",subscribeCommand,-2,"",0,NULL,0,0,0,0,0},
394 {"unsubscribe",unsubscribeCommand,-1,"",0,NULL,0,0,0,0,0},
395 {"psubscribe",psubscribeCommand,-2,"",0,NULL,0,0,0,0,0},
396 {"punsubscribe",punsubscribeCommand,-1,"",0,NULL,0,0,0,0,0},
397 {"publish",sentinelPublishCommand,3,"",0,NULL,0,0,0,0,0},
398 {"info",sentinelInfoCommand,-1,"",0,NULL,0,0,0,0,0},
399 {"role",sentinelRoleCommand,1,"l",0,NULL,0,0,0,0,0},
400 {"client",clientCommand,-2,"rs",0,NULL,0,0,0,0,0},
401 {"shutdown",shutdownCommand,-1,"",0,NULL,0,0,0,0,0}
402};

404/* This function overwrites a few normal Redis config default with Sentinel
405 * specific defaults. */
406void initSentinelConfig(void) {
407 server.port = REDIS_SENTINEL_PORT;
408}
409
410/* Perform the Sentinel mode initialization. */
411void initSentinel(void) {
412 unsigned int j;
413
414 /* Remove usual Redis commands from the command table, then just add
415 * the SENTINEL command. */
416 dictEmpty(server.commands,NULL);
417 for (j = 0; j < sizeof(sentinelcmds)/sizeof(sentinelcmds[0]); j++) {
418 int retval;
419 struct redisCommand *cmd = sentinelcmds+j;
420
421 retval = dictAdd(server.commands, sdsnew(cmd->name), cmd);
422 redisAssert(retval == DICT_OK);
423 }
424
425 /* Initialize various data structures. */
426 sentinel.current_epoch = 0;
427 sentinel.masters = dictCreate(&instancesDictType,NULL);
428 sentinel.tilt = 0;
429 sentinel.tilt_start_time = 0;
430 sentinel.previous_time = mstime();
431 sentinel.running_scripts = 0;
432 sentinel.scripts_queue = listCreate();
433 sentinel.announce_ip = NULL;
434 sentinel.announce_port = 0;
435}
436
437/* This function gets called when the server is in Sentinel mode, started,
438 * loaded the configuration, and is ready for normal operations. */
439void sentinelIsRunning(void) {
440 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,"Sentinel runid is %s", server.runid);
441
442 if (server.configfile == NULL) {
443 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,
444 "Sentinel started without a config file. Exiting...");
445 exit(1);
446 } else if (access(server.configfile,W_OK) == -1) {
447 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,
448 "Sentinel config file %s is not writable: %s. Exiting...",
449 server.configfile,strerror(errno));
450 exit(1);
451 }
452
453 /* We want to generate a +monitor event for every configured master
454 * at startup. */
455 sentinelGenerateInitialMonitorEvents();
456}
457
458/* ============================== sentinelAddr ============================== */
459
460/* Create a sentinelAddr object and return it on success.
461 * On error NULL is returned and errno is set to:
462 * ENOENT: Can't resolve the hostname.
463 * EINVAL: Invalid port number.
464 */
465sentinelAddr *createSentinelAddr(char *hostname, int port) {
466 char ip[REDIS_IP_STR_LEN];
467 sentinelAddr *sa;
468
469 if (port <= 0 || port > 65535) {
470 errno = EINVAL;
471 return NULL;
472 }
473 if (anetResolve(NULL,hostname,ip,sizeof(ip)) == ANET_ERR) {
474 errno = ENOENT;
475 return NULL;
476 }
477 sa = zmalloc(sizeof(*sa));
478 sa->ip = sdsnew(ip);
479 sa->port = port;
480 return sa;
481}
482
483/* Return a duplicate of the source address. */
484sentinelAddr *dupSentinelAddr(sentinelAddr *src) {
485 sentinelAddr *sa;
486
487 sa = zmalloc(sizeof(*sa));
488 sa->ip = sdsnew(src->ip);
489 sa->port = src->port;
490 return sa;
491}
492
493/* Free a Sentinel address. Can't fail. */
494void releaseSentinelAddr(sentinelAddr *sa) {
495 sdsfree(sa->ip);
496 zfree(sa);
497}
498
499/* Return non-zero if two addresses are equal. */
500int sentinelAddrIsEqual(sentinelAddr *a, sentinelAddr *b) {
501 return a->port == b->port && !strcasecmp(a->ip,b->ip);
502}
503
504/* =========================== Events notification ========================== */
505
506/* Send an event to log, pub/sub, user notification script.
507 *
508 * 'level' is the log level for logging. Only REDIS_WARNING events will trigger
509 * the execution of the user notification script.
510 *
511 * 'type' is the message type, also used as a pub/sub channel name.
512 *
513 * 'ri', is the redis instance target of this event if applicable, and is
514 * used to obtain the path of the notification script to execute.
515 *
516 * The remaining arguments are printf-alike.
517 * If the format specifier starts with the two characters "%@" then ri is
518 * not NULL, and the message is prefixed with an instance identifier in the
519 * following format:
520 *
521 * <instance type> <instance name> <ip> <port>
522 *
523 * If the instance type is not master, than the additional string is
524 * added to specify the originating master:
525 *
526 * @ <master name> <master ip> <master port>
527 *
528 * Any other specifier after "%@" is processed by printf itself.
529 */
530void sentinelEvent(int level, char *type, sentinelRedisInstance *ri,
531 const char *fmt, ...) {
532 va_list ap;
533 char msg[REDIS_MAX_LOGMSG_LEN];
534 robj *channel, *payload;
535
536 /* Handle %@ */
537 if (fmt[0] == '%' && fmt[1] == '@') {
538 sentinelRedisInstance *master = (ri->flags & SRI_MASTER) ?
539 NULL : ri->master;
540
541 if (master) {
542 snprintf(msg, sizeof(msg), "%s %s %s %d @ %s %s %d",
543 sentinelRedisInstanceTypeStr(ri),
544 ri->name, ri->addr->ip, ri->addr->port,
545 master->name, master->addr->ip, master->addr->port);
546 } else {
547 snprintf(msg, sizeof(msg), "%s %s %s %d",
548 sentinelRedisInstanceTypeStr(ri),
549 ri->name, ri->addr->ip, ri->addr->port);
550 }
551 fmt += 2;
552 } else {
553 msg[0] = '\0';
554 }
555
556 /* Use vsprintf for the rest of the formatting if any. */
557 if (fmt[0] != '\0') {
558 va_start(ap, fmt);
559 vsnprintf(msg+strlen(msg), sizeof(msg)-strlen(msg), fmt, ap);
560 va_end(ap);
561 }
562
563 /* Log the message if the log level allows it to be logged. */
564 if (level >= server.verbosity)
565 redisLog(level,"%s %s",type,msg);
566
567 /* Publish the message via Pub/Sub if it's not a debugging one. */
568 if (level != REDIS_DEBUG) {
569 channel = createStringObject(type,strlen(type));
570 payload = createStringObject(msg,strlen(msg));
571 pubsubPublishMessage(channel,payload);
572 decrRefCount(channel);
573 decrRefCount(payload);
574 }
575
576 /* Call the notification script if applicable. */
577 if (level == REDIS_WARNING && ri != NULL) {
578 sentinelRedisInstance *master = (ri->flags & SRI_MASTER) ?
579 ri : ri->master;
580 if (master->notification_script) {
581 sentinelScheduleScriptExecution(master->notification_script,
582 type,msg,NULL);
583 }
584 }
585}
586
587/* This function is called only at startup and is used to generate a
588 * +monitor event for every configured master. The same events are also
589 * generated when a master to monitor is added at runtime via the
590 * SENTINEL MONITOR command. */
591void sentinelGenerateInitialMonitorEvents(void) {
592 dictIterator *di;
593 dictEntry *de;
594
595 di = dictGetIterator(sentinel.masters);
596 while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
597 sentinelRedisInstance *ri = dictGetVal(de);
598 sentinelEvent(REDIS_WARNING,"+monitor",ri,"%@ quorum %d",ri->quorum);
599 }
600 dictReleaseIterator(di);
601}
602
603/* ============================ script execution ============================ */
604
605/* Release a script job structure and all the associated data. */
606void sentinelReleaseScriptJob(sentinelScriptJob *sj) {
607 int j = 0;
608
609 while(sj->argv[j]) sdsfree(sj->argv[j++]);
610 zfree(sj->argv);
611 zfree(sj);
612}
613
614#define SENTINEL_SCRIPT_MAX_ARGS 16
615void sentinelScheduleScriptExecution(char *path, ...) {
616 va_list ap;
617 char *argv[SENTINEL_SCRIPT_MAX_ARGS+1];
618 int argc = 1;
619 sentinelScriptJob *sj;
620
621 va_start(ap, path);
622 while(argc < SENTINEL_SCRIPT_MAX_ARGS) {
623 argv[argc] = va_arg(ap,char*);
624 if (!argv[argc]) break;
625 argv[argc] = sdsnew(argv[argc]); /* Copy the string. */
626 argc++;
627 }
628 va_end(ap);
629 argv[0] = sdsnew(path);
630
631 sj = zmalloc(sizeof(*sj));
632 sj->flags = SENTINEL_SCRIPT_NONE;
633 sj->retry_num = 0;
634 sj->argv = zmalloc(sizeof(char*)*(argc+1));
635 sj->start_time = 0;
636 sj->pid = 0;
637 memcpy(sj->argv,argv,sizeof(char*)*(argc+1));
638
639 listAddNodeTail(sentinel.scripts_queue,sj);
640
641 /* Remove the oldest non running script if we already hit the limit. */
642 if (listLength(sentinel.scripts_queue) > SENTINEL_SCRIPT_MAX_QUEUE) {
643 listNode *ln;
644 listIter li;
645
646 listRewind(sentinel.scripts_queue,&li);
647 while ((ln = listNext(&li)) != NULL) {
648 sj = ln->value;
649
650 if (sj->flags & SENTINEL_SCRIPT_RUNNING) continue;
651 /* The first node is the oldest as we add on tail. */
652 listDelNode(sentinel.scripts_queue,ln);
653 sentinelReleaseScriptJob(sj);
654 break;
655 }
656 redisAssert(listLength(sentinel.scripts_queue) <=
657 SENTINEL_SCRIPT_MAX_QUEUE);
658 }
659}
660
661/* Lookup a script in the scripts queue via pid, and returns the list node
662 * (so that we can easily remove it from the queue if needed). */
663listNode *sentinelGetScriptListNodeByPid(pid_t pid) {
664 listNode *ln;
665 listIter li;
666
667 listRewind(sentinel.scripts_queue,&li);
668 while ((ln = listNext(&li)) != NULL) {
669 sentinelScriptJob *sj = ln->value;
670
671 if ((sj->flags & SENTINEL_SCRIPT_RUNNING) && sj->pid == pid)
672 return ln;
673 }
674 return NULL;
675}
676
677/* Run pending scripts if we are not already at max number of running
678 * scripts. */
679void sentinelRunPendingScripts(void) {
680 listNode *ln;
681 listIter li;
682 mstime_t now = mstime();
683
684 /* Find jobs that are not running and run them, from the top to the
685 * tail of the queue, so we run older jobs first. */
686 listRewind(sentinel.scripts_queue,&li);
687 while (sentinel.running_scripts < SENTINEL_SCRIPT_MAX_RUNNING &&
688 (ln = listNext(&li)) != NULL)
689 {
690 sentinelScriptJob *sj = ln->value;
691 pid_t pid;
692
693 /* Skip if already running. */
694 if (sj->flags & SENTINEL_SCRIPT_RUNNING) continue;
695
696 /* Skip if it's a retry, but not enough time has elapsed. */
697 if (sj->start_time && sj->start_time > now) continue;
698
699 sj->flags |= SENTINEL_SCRIPT_RUNNING;
700 sj->start_time = mstime();
701 sj->retry_num++;
702 pid = fork();
703
704 if (pid == -1) {
705 /* Parent (fork error).
706 * We report fork errors as signal 99, in order to unify the
707 * reporting with other kind of errors. */
708 sentinelEvent(REDIS_WARNING,"-script-error",NULL,
709 "%s %d %d", sj->argv[0], 99, 0);
710 sj->flags &= ~SENTINEL_SCRIPT_RUNNING;
711 sj->pid = 0;
712 } else if (pid == 0) {
713 /* Child */
714 execve(sj->argv[0],sj->argv,environ);
715 /* If we are here an error occurred. */
716 _exit(2); /* Don't retry execution. */
717 } else {
718 sentinel.running_scripts++;
719 sj->pid = pid;
720 sentinelEvent(REDIS_DEBUG,"+script-child",NULL,"%ld",(long)pid);
721 }
722 }
723}
724
725/* How much to delay the execution of a script that we need to retry after
726 * an error?
727 *
728 * We double the retry delay for every further retry we do. So for instance
729 * if RETRY_DELAY is set to 30 seconds and the max number of retries is 10
730 * starting from the second attempt to execute the script the delays are:
731 * 30 sec, 60 sec, 2 min, 4 min, 8 min, 16 min, 32 min, 64 min, 128 min. */
732mstime_t sentinelScriptRetryDelay(int retry_num) {
733 mstime_t delay = SENTINEL_SCRIPT_RETRY_DELAY;
734
735 while (retry_num-- > 1) delay *= 2;
736 return delay;
737}
738
739/* Check for scripts that terminated, and remove them from the queue if the
740 * script terminated successfully. If instead the script was terminated by
741 * a signal, or returned exit code "1", it is scheduled to run again if
742 * the max number of retries did not already elapsed. */
743void sentinelCollectTerminatedScripts(void) {
744 int statloc;
745 pid_t pid;
746
747 while ((pid = wait3(&statloc,WNOHANG,NULL)) > 0) {
748 int exitcode = WEXITSTATUS(statloc);
749 int bysignal = 0;
750 listNode *ln;
751 sentinelScriptJob *sj;
752
753 if (WIFSIGNALED(statloc)) bysignal = WTERMSIG(statloc);
754 sentinelEvent(REDIS_DEBUG,"-script-child",NULL,"%ld %d %d",
755 (long)pid, exitcode, bysignal);
756
757 ln = sentinelGetScriptListNodeByPid(pid);
758 if (ln == NULL) {
759 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,"wait3() returned a pid (%ld) we can't find in our scripts execution queue!", (long)pid);
760 continue;
761 }
762 sj = ln->value;
763
764 /* If the script was terminated by a signal or returns an
765 * exit code of "1" (that means: please retry), we reschedule it
766 * if the max number of retries is not already reached. */
767 if ((bysignal || exitcode == 1) &&
768 sj->retry_num != SENTINEL_SCRIPT_MAX_RETRY)
769 {
770 sj->flags &= ~SENTINEL_SCRIPT_RUNNING;
771 sj->pid = 0;
772 sj->start_time = mstime() +
773 sentinelScriptRetryDelay(sj->retry_num);
774 } else {
775 /* Otherwise let's remove the script, but log the event if the
776 * execution did not terminated in the best of the ways. */
777 if (bysignal || exitcode != 0) {
778 sentinelEvent(REDIS_WARNING,"-script-error",NULL,
779 "%s %d %d", sj->argv[0], bysignal, exitcode);
780 }
781 listDelNode(sentinel.scripts_queue,ln);
782 sentinelReleaseScriptJob(sj);
783 sentinel.running_scripts--;
784 }
785 }
786}
787
788/* Kill scripts in timeout, they'll be collected by the
789 * sentinelCollectTerminatedScripts() function. */
790void sentinelKillTimedoutScripts(void) {
791 listNode *ln;
792 listIter li;
793 mstime_t now = mstime();
794
795 listRewind(sentinel.scripts_queue,&li);
796 while ((ln = listNext(&li)) != NULL) {
797 sentinelScriptJob *sj = ln->value;
798
799 if (sj->flags & SENTINEL_SCRIPT_RUNNING &&
800 (now - sj->start_time) > SENTINEL_SCRIPT_MAX_RUNTIME)
801 {
802 sentinelEvent(REDIS_WARNING,"-script-timeout",NULL,"%s %ld",
803 sj->argv[0], (long)sj->pid);
804 kill(sj->pid,SIGKILL);
805 }
806 }
807}
808
809/* Implements SENTINEL PENDING-SCRIPTS command. */
810void sentinelPendingScriptsCommand(redisClient *c) {
811 listNode *ln;
812 listIter li;
813
814 addReplyMultiBulkLen(c,listLength(sentinel.scripts_queue));
815 listRewind(sentinel.scripts_queue,&li);
816 while ((ln = listNext(&li)) != NULL) {
817 sentinelScriptJob *sj = ln->value;
818 int j = 0;
819
820 addReplyMultiBulkLen(c,10);
821
822 addReplyBulkCString(c,"argv");
823 while (sj->argv[j]) j++;
824 addReplyMultiBulkLen(c,j);
825 j = 0;
826 while (sj->argv[j]) addReplyBulkCString(c,sj->argv[j++]);
827
828 addReplyBulkCString(c,"flags");
829 addReplyBulkCString(c,
830 (sj->flags & SENTINEL_SCRIPT_RUNNING) ? "running" : "scheduled");
831
832 addReplyBulkCString(c,"pid");
833 addReplyBulkLongLong(c,sj->pid);
834
835 if (sj->flags & SENTINEL_SCRIPT_RUNNING) {
836 addReplyBulkCString(c,"run-time");
837 addReplyBulkLongLong(c,mstime() - sj->start_time);
838 } else {
839 mstime_t delay = sj->start_time ? (sj->start_time-mstime()) : 0;
840 if (delay < 0) delay = 0;
841 addReplyBulkCString(c,"run-delay");
842 addReplyBulkLongLong(c,delay);
843 }
844
845 addReplyBulkCString(c,"retry-num");
846 addReplyBulkLongLong(c,sj->retry_num);
847 }
848}
849
850/* This function calls, if any, the client reconfiguration script with the
851 * following parameters:
852 *
853 * <master-name> <role> <state> <from-ip> <from-port> <to-ip> <to-port>
854 *
855 * It is called every time a failover is performed.
856 *
857 * <state> is currently always "failover".
858 * <role> is either "leader" or "observer".
859 *
860 * from/to fields are respectively master -> promoted slave addresses for
861 * "start" and "end". */
862void sentinelCallClientReconfScript(sentinelRedisInstance *master, int role, char *state, sentinelAddr *from, sentinelAddr *to) {
863 char fromport[32], toport[32];
864
865 if (master->client_reconfig_script == NULL) return;
866 ll2string(fromport,sizeof(fromport),from->port);
867 ll2string(toport,sizeof(toport),to->port);
868 sentinelScheduleScriptExecution(master->client_reconfig_script,
869 master->name,
870 (role == SENTINEL_LEADER) ? "leader" : "observer",
871 state, from->ip, fromport, to->ip, toport, NULL);
872}
873
874/* ========================== sentinelRedisInstance ========================= */
875
876/* Create a redis instance, the following fields must be populated by the
877 * caller if needed:
878 * runid: set to NULL but will be populated once INFO output is received.
879 * info_refresh: is set to 0 to mean that we never received INFO so far.
880 *
881 * If SRI_MASTER is set into initial flags the instance is added to
882 * sentinel.masters table.
883 *
884 * if SRI_SLAVE or SRI_SENTINEL is set then 'master' must be not NULL and the
885 * instance is added into master->slaves or master->sentinels table.
886 *
887 * If the instance is a slave or sentinel, the name parameter is ignored and
888 * is created automatically as hostname:port.
889 *
890 * The function fails if hostname can't be resolved or port is out of range.
891 * When this happens NULL is returned and errno is set accordingly to the
892 * createSentinelAddr() function.
893 *
894 * The function may also fail and return NULL with errno set to EBUSY if
895 * a master or slave with the same name already exists. */
896sentinelRedisInstance *createSentinelRedisInstance(char *name, int flags, char *hostname, int port, int quorum, sentinelRedisInstance *master) {
897 sentinelRedisInstance *ri;
898 sentinelAddr *addr;
899 dict *table = NULL;
900 char slavename[128], *sdsname;
901
902 redisAssert(flags & (SRI_MASTER|SRI_SLAVE|SRI_SENTINEL));
903 redisAssert((flags & SRI_MASTER) || master != NULL);
904
905 /* Check address validity. */
906 addr = createSentinelAddr(hostname,port);
907 if (addr == NULL) return NULL;
908
909 /* For slaves and sentinel we use ip:port as name. */
910 if (flags & (SRI_SLAVE|SRI_SENTINEL)) {
911 snprintf(slavename,sizeof(slavename),
912 strchr(hostname,':') ? "[%s]:%d" : "%s:%d",
913 hostname,port);
914 name = slavename;
915 }
916
917 /* Make sure the entry is not duplicated. This may happen when the same
918 * name for a master is used multiple times inside the configuration or
919 * if we try to add multiple times a slave or sentinel with same ip/port
920 * to a master. */
921 if (flags & SRI_MASTER) table = sentinel.masters;
922 else if (flags & SRI_SLAVE) table = master->slaves;
923 else if (flags & SRI_SENTINEL) table = master->sentinels;
924 sdsname = sdsnew(name);
925 if (dictFind(table,sdsname)) {
926 sdsfree(sdsname);
927 errno = EBUSY;
928 return NULL;
929 }
930
931 /* Create the instance object. */
932 ri = zmalloc(sizeof(*ri));
933 /* Note that all the instances are started in the disconnected state,
934 * the event loop will take care of connecting them. */
935 ri->flags = flags | SRI_DISCONNECTED;
936 ri->name = sdsname;
937 ri->runid = NULL;
938 ri->config_epoch = 0;
939 ri->addr = addr;
940 ri->cc = NULL;
941 ri->pc = NULL;
942 ri->pending_commands = 0;
943 ri->cc_conn_time = 0;
944 ri->pc_conn_time = 0;
945 ri->pc_last_activity = 0;
946 /* We set the last_ping_time to "now" even if we actually don't have yet
947 * a connection with the node, nor we sent a ping.
948 * This is useful to detect a timeout in case we'll not be able to connect
949 * with the node at all. */
950 ri->last_ping_time = mstime();
951 ri->last_avail_time = mstime();
952 ri->last_pong_time = mstime();
953 ri->last_pub_time = mstime();
954 ri->last_hello_time = mstime();
955 ri->last_master_down_reply_time = mstime();
956 ri->s_down_since_time = 0;
957 ri->o_down_since_time = 0;
958 ri->down_after_period = master ? master->down_after_period :
959 SENTINEL_DEFAULT_DOWN_AFTER;
960 ri->master_link_down_time = 0;
961 ri->auth_pass = NULL;
962 ri->slave_priority = SENTINEL_DEFAULT_SLAVE_PRIORITY;
963 ri->slave_reconf_sent_time = 0;
964 ri->slave_master_host = NULL;
965 ri->slave_master_port = 0;
966 ri->slave_master_link_status = SENTINEL_MASTER_LINK_STATUS_DOWN;
967 ri->slave_repl_offset = 0;
968 ri->sentinels = dictCreate(&instancesDictType,NULL);
969 ri->quorum = quorum;
970 ri->parallel_syncs = SENTINEL_DEFAULT_PARALLEL_SYNCS;
971 ri->master = master;
972 ri->slaves = dictCreate(&instancesDictType,NULL);
973 ri->info_refresh = 0;
974
975 /* Failover state. */
976 ri->leader = NULL;
977 ri->leader_epoch = 0;
978 ri->failover_epoch = 0;
979 ri->failover_state = SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_NONE;
980 ri->failover_state_change_time = 0;
981 ri->failover_start_time = 0;
982 ri->failover_timeout = SENTINEL_DEFAULT_FAILOVER_TIMEOUT;
983 ri->failover_delay_logged = 0;
984 ri->promoted_slave = NULL;
985 ri->notification_script = NULL;
986 ri->client_reconfig_script = NULL;
987
988 /* Role */
989 ri->role_reported = ri->flags & (SRI_MASTER|SRI_SLAVE);
990 ri->role_reported_time = mstime();
991 ri->slave_conf_change_time = mstime();
992
993 /* Add into the right table. */
994 dictAdd(table, ri->name, ri);
995 return ri;
996}
997
998/* Release this instance and all its slaves, sentinels, hiredis connections.
999 * This function does not take care of unlinking the instance from the main
1000 * masters table (if it is a master) or from its master sentinels/slaves table
1001 * if it is a slave or sentinel. */
1002void releaseSentinelRedisInstance(sentinelRedisInstance *ri) {
1003 /* Release all its slaves or sentinels if any. */
1004 dictRelease(ri->sentinels);
1005 dictRelease(ri->slaves);
1006
1007 /* Release hiredis connections. */
1008 if (ri->cc) sentinelKillLink(ri,ri->cc);
1009 if (ri->pc) sentinelKillLink(ri,ri->pc);
1010
1011 /* Free other resources. */
1012 sdsfree(ri->name);
1013 sdsfree(ri->runid);
1014 sdsfree(ri->notification_script);
1015 sdsfree(ri->client_reconfig_script);
1016 sdsfree(ri->slave_master_host);
1017 sdsfree(ri->leader);
1018 sdsfree(ri->auth_pass);
1019 releaseSentinelAddr(ri->addr);
1020
1021 /* Clear state into the master if needed. */
1022 if ((ri->flags & SRI_SLAVE) && (ri->flags & SRI_PROMOTED) && ri->master)
1023 ri->master->promoted_slave = NULL;
1024
1025 zfree(ri);
1026}
1027
1028/* Lookup a slave in a master Redis instance, by ip and port. */
1029sentinelRedisInstance *sentinelRedisInstanceLookupSlave(
1030 sentinelRedisInstance *ri, char *ip, int port)
1031{
1032 sds key;
1033 sentinelRedisInstance *slave;
1034
1035 redisAssert(ri->flags & SRI_MASTER);
1036 key = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),
1037 strchr(ip,':') ? "[%s]:%d" : "%s:%d",
1038 ip,port);
1039 slave = dictFetchValue(ri->slaves,key);
1040 sdsfree(key);
1041 return slave;
1042}
1043
1044/* Return the name of the type of the instance as a string. */
1045const char *sentinelRedisInstanceTypeStr(sentinelRedisInstance *ri) {
1046 if (ri->flags & SRI_MASTER) return "master";
1047 else if (ri->flags & SRI_SLAVE) return "slave";
1048 else if (ri->flags & SRI_SENTINEL) return "sentinel";
1049 else return "unknown";
1050}
1051
1052/* This function removes all the instances found in the dictionary of
1053 * sentinels in the specified 'master', having either:
1054 *
1055 * 1) The same ip/port as specified.
1056 * 2) The same runid.
1057 *
1058 * "1" and "2" don't need to verify at the same time, just one is enough.
1059 * If "runid" is NULL it is not checked.
1060 * Similarly if "ip" is NULL it is not checked.
1061 *
1062 * This function is useful because every time we add a new Sentinel into
1063 * a master's Sentinels dictionary, we want to be very sure about not
1064 * having duplicated instances for any reason. This is important because
1065 * other sentinels are needed to reach ODOWN quorum, and later to get
1066 * voted for a given configuration epoch in order to perform the failover.
1067 *
1068 * The function returns the number of Sentinels removed. */
1069int removeMatchingSentinelsFromMaster(sentinelRedisInstance *master, char *ip, int port, char *runid) {
1070 dictIterator *di;
1071 dictEntry *de;
1072 int removed = 0;
1073
1074 di = dictGetSafeIterator(master->sentinels);
1075 while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
1076 sentinelRedisInstance *ri = dictGetVal(de);
1077
1078 if ((ri->runid && runid && strcmp(ri->runid,runid) == 0) ||
1079 (ip && strcmp(ri->addr->ip,ip) == 0 && port == ri->addr->port))
1080 {
1081 dictDelete(master->sentinels,ri->name);
1082 removed++;
1083 }
1084 }
1085 dictReleaseIterator(di);
1086 return removed;
1087}
1088
1089/* Search an instance with the same runid, ip and port into a dictionary
1090 * of instances. Return NULL if not found, otherwise return the instance
1091 * pointer.
1092 *
1093 * runid or ip can be NULL. In such a case the search is performed only
1094 * by the non-NULL field. */
1095sentinelRedisInstance *getSentinelRedisInstanceByAddrAndRunID(dict *instances, char *ip, int port, char *runid) {
1096 dictIterator *di;
1097 dictEntry *de;
1098 sentinelRedisInstance *instance = NULL;
1099
1100 redisAssert(ip || runid); /* User must pass at least one search param. */
1101 di = dictGetIterator(instances);
1102 while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
1103 sentinelRedisInstance *ri = dictGetVal(de);
1104
1105 if (runid && !ri->runid) continue;
1106 if ((runid == NULL || strcmp(ri->runid, runid) == 0) &&
1107 (ip == NULL || (strcmp(ri->addr->ip, ip) == 0 &&
1108 ri->addr->port == port)))
1109 {
1110 instance = ri;
1111 break;
1112 }
1113 }
1114 dictReleaseIterator(di);
1115 return instance;
1116}
1117
1118/* Master lookup by name */
1119sentinelRedisInstance *sentinelGetMasterByName(char *name) {
1120 sentinelRedisInstance *ri;
1121 sds sdsname = sdsnew(name);
1122
1123 ri = dictFetchValue(sentinel.masters,sdsname);
1124 sdsfree(sdsname);
1125 return ri;
1126}
1127
1128/* Add the specified flags to all the instances in the specified dictionary. */
1129void sentinelAddFlagsToDictOfRedisInstances(dict *instances, int flags) {
1130 dictIterator *di;
1131 dictEntry *de;
1132
1133 di = dictGetIterator(instances);
1134 while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
1135 sentinelRedisInstance *ri = dictGetVal(de);
1136 ri->flags |= flags;
1137 }
1138 dictReleaseIterator(di);
1139}
1140
1141/* Remove the specified flags to all the instances in the specified
1142 * dictionary. */
1143void sentinelDelFlagsToDictOfRedisInstances(dict *instances, int flags) {
1144 dictIterator *di;
1145 dictEntry *de;
1146
1147 di = dictGetIterator(instances);
1148 while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
1149 sentinelRedisInstance *ri = dictGetVal(de);
1150 ri->flags &= ~flags;
1151 }
1152 dictReleaseIterator(di);
1153}
1154
1155/* Reset the state of a monitored master:
1156 * 1) Remove all slaves.
1157 * 2) Remove all sentinels.
1158 * 3) Remove most of the flags resulting from runtime operations.
1159 * 4) Reset timers to their default value.
1160 * 5) In the process of doing this undo the failover if in progress.
1161 * 6) Disconnect the connections with the master (will reconnect automatically).
1162 */
1163
1164#define SENTINEL_RESET_NO_SENTINELS (1<<0)
1165void sentinelResetMaster(sentinelRedisInstance *ri, int flags) {
1166 redisAssert(ri->flags & SRI_MASTER);
1167 dictRelease(ri->slaves);
1168 ri->slaves = dictCreate(&instancesDictType,NULL);
1169 if (!(flags & SENTINEL_RESET_NO_SENTINELS)) {
1170 dictRelease(ri->sentinels);
1171 ri->sentinels = dictCreate(&instancesDictType,NULL);
1172 }
1173 if (ri->cc) sentinelKillLink(ri,ri->cc);
1174 if (ri->pc) sentinelKillLink(ri,ri->pc);
1175 ri->flags &= SRI_MASTER|SRI_DISCONNECTED;
1176 if (ri->leader) {
1177 sdsfree(ri->leader);
1178 ri->leader = NULL;
1179 }
1180 ri->failover_state = SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_NONE;
1181 ri->failover_state_change_time = 0;
1182 ri->failover_start_time = 0;
1183 ri->promoted_slave = NULL;
1184 sdsfree(ri->runid);
1185 sdsfree(ri->slave_master_host);
1186 ri->runid = NULL;
1187 ri->slave_master_host = NULL;
1188 ri->last_ping_time = mstime();
1189 ri->last_avail_time = mstime();
1190 ri->last_pong_time = mstime();
1191 ri->role_reported_time = mstime();
1192 ri->role_reported = SRI_MASTER;
1193 if (flags & SENTINEL_GENERATE_EVENT)
1194 sentinelEvent(REDIS_WARNING,"+reset-master",ri,"%@");
1195}
1196
1197/* Call sentinelResetMaster() on every master with a name matching the specified
1198 * pattern. */
1199int sentinelResetMastersByPattern(char *pattern, int flags) {
1200 dictIterator *di;
1201 dictEntry *de;
1202 int reset = 0;
1203
1204 di = dictGetIterator(sentinel.masters);
1205 while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
1206 sentinelRedisInstance *ri = dictGetVal(de);
1207
1208 if (ri->name) {
1209 if (stringmatch(pattern,ri->name,0)) {
1210 sentinelResetMaster(ri,flags);
1211 reset++;
1212 }
1213 }
1214 }
1215 dictReleaseIterator(di);
1216 return reset;
1217}
1218
1219/* Reset the specified master with sentinelResetMaster(), and also change
1220 * the ip:port address, but take the name of the instance unmodified.
1221 *
1222 * This is used to handle the +switch-master event.
1223 *
1224 * The function returns REDIS_ERR if the address can't be resolved for some
1225 * reason. Otherwise REDIS_OK is returned. */
1226int sentinelResetMasterAndChangeAddress(sentinelRedisInstance *master, char *ip, int port) {
1227 sentinelAddr *oldaddr, *newaddr;
1228 sentinelAddr **slaves = NULL;
1229 int numslaves = 0, j;
1230 dictIterator *di;
1231 dictEntry *de;
1232
1233 newaddr = createSentinelAddr(ip,port);
1234 if (newaddr == NULL) return REDIS_ERR;
1235
1236 /* Make a list of slaves to add back after the reset.
1237 * Don't include the one having the address we are switching to. */
1238 di = dictGetIterator(master->slaves);
1239 while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
1240 sentinelRedisInstance *slave = dictGetVal(de);
1241
1242 if (sentinelAddrIsEqual(slave->addr,newaddr)) continue;
1243 slaves = zrealloc(slaves,sizeof(sentinelAddr*)*(numslaves+1));
1244 slaves[numslaves++] = createSentinelAddr(slave->addr->ip,
1245 slave->addr->port);
1246 }
1247 dictReleaseIterator(di);
1248
1249 /* If we are switching to a different address, include the old address
1250 * as a slave as well, so that we'll be able to sense / reconfigure
1251 * the old master. */
1252 if (!sentinelAddrIsEqual(newaddr,master->addr)) {
1253 slaves = zrealloc(slaves,sizeof(sentinelAddr*)*(numslaves+1));
1254 slaves[numslaves++] = createSentinelAddr(master->addr->ip,
1255 master->addr->port);
1256 }
1257
1258 /* Reset and switch address. */
1259 sentinelResetMaster(master,SENTINEL_RESET_NO_SENTINELS);
1260 oldaddr = master->addr;
1261 master->addr = newaddr;
1262 master->o_down_since_time = 0;
1263 master->s_down_since_time = 0;
1264
1265 /* Add slaves back. */
1266 for (j = 0; j < numslaves; j++) {
1267 sentinelRedisInstance *slave;
1268
1269 slave = createSentinelRedisInstance(NULL,SRI_SLAVE,slaves[j]->ip,
1270 slaves[j]->port, master->quorum, master);
1271 releaseSentinelAddr(slaves[j]);
1272 if (slave) {
1273 sentinelEvent(REDIS_NOTICE,"+slave",slave,"%@");
1274 sentinelFlushConfig();
1275 }
1276 }
1277 zfree(slaves);
1278
1279 /* Release the old address at the end so we are safe even if the function
1280 * gets the master->addr->ip and master->addr->port as arguments. */
1281 releaseSentinelAddr(oldaddr);
1282 sentinelFlushConfig();
1283 return REDIS_OK;
1284}
1285
1286/* Return non-zero if there was no SDOWN or ODOWN error associated to this
1287 * instance in the latest 'ms' milliseconds. */
1288int sentinelRedisInstanceNoDownFor(sentinelRedisInstance *ri, mstime_t ms) {
1289 mstime_t most_recent;
1290
1291 most_recent = ri->s_down_since_time;
1292 if (ri->o_down_since_time > most_recent)
1293 most_recent = ri->o_down_since_time;
1294 return most_recent == 0 || (mstime() - most_recent) > ms;
1295}
1296
1297/* Return the current master address, that is, its address or the address
1298 * of the promoted slave if already operational. */
1299sentinelAddr *sentinelGetCurrentMasterAddress(sentinelRedisInstance *master) {
1300 /* If we are failing over the master, and the state is already
1301 * SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_RECONF_SLAVES or greater, it means that we
1302 * already have the new configuration epoch in the master, and the
1303 * slave acknowledged the configuration switch. Advertise the new
1304 * address. */
1305 if ((master->flags & SRI_FAILOVER_IN_PROGRESS) &&
1306 master->promoted_slave &&
1307 master->failover_state >= SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_RECONF_SLAVES)
1308 {
1309 return master->promoted_slave->addr;
1310 } else {
1311 return master->addr;
1312 }
1313}
1314
1315/* This function sets the down_after_period field value in 'master' to all
1316 * the slaves and sentinel instances connected to this master. */
1317void sentinelPropagateDownAfterPeriod(sentinelRedisInstance *master) {
1318 dictIterator *di;
1319 dictEntry *de;
1320 int j;
1321 dict *d[] = {master->slaves, master->sentinels, NULL};
1322
1323 for (j = 0; d[j]; j++) {
1324 di = dictGetIterator(d[j]);
1325 while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
1326 sentinelRedisInstance *ri = dictGetVal(de);
1327 ri->down_after_period = master->down_after_period;
1328 }
1329 dictReleaseIterator(di);
1330 }
1331}
1332
1333/* ============================ Config handling ============================= */
1334char *sentinelHandleConfiguration(char **argv, int argc) {
1335 sentinelRedisInstance *ri;
1336
1337 if (!strcasecmp(argv[0],"monitor") && argc == 5) {
1338 /* monitor <name> <host> <port> <quorum> */
1339 int quorum = atoi(argv[4]);
1340
1341 if (quorum <= 0) return "Quorum must be 1 or greater.";
1342 if (createSentinelRedisInstance(argv[1],SRI_MASTER,argv[2],
1343 atoi(argv[3]),quorum,NULL) == NULL)
1344 {
1345 switch(errno) {
1346 case EBUSY: return "Duplicated master name.";
1347 case ENOENT: return "Can't resolve master instance hostname.";
1348 case EINVAL: return "Invalid port number";
1349 }
1350 }
1351 } else if (!strcasecmp(argv[0],"down-after-milliseconds") && argc == 3) {
1352 /* down-after-milliseconds <name> <milliseconds> */
1353 ri = sentinelGetMasterByName(argv[1]);
1354 if (!ri) return "No such master with specified name.";
1355 ri->down_after_period = atoi(argv[2]);
1356 if (ri->down_after_period <= 0)
1357 return "negative or zero time parameter.";
1358 sentinelPropagateDownAfterPeriod(ri);
1359 } else if (!strcasecmp(argv[0],"failover-timeout") && argc == 3) {
1360 /* failover-timeout <name> <milliseconds> */
1361 ri = sentinelGetMasterByName(argv[1]);
1362 if (!ri) return "No such master with specified name.";
1363 ri->failover_timeout = atoi(argv[2]);
1364 if (ri->failover_timeout <= 0)
1365 return "negative or zero time parameter.";
1366 } else if (!strcasecmp(argv[0],"parallel-syncs") && argc == 3) {
1367 /* parallel-syncs <name> <milliseconds> */
1368 ri = sentinelGetMasterByName(argv[1]);
1369 if (!ri) return "No such master with specified name.";
1370 ri->parallel_syncs = atoi(argv[2]);
1371 } else if (!strcasecmp(argv[0],"notification-script") && argc == 3) {
1372 /* notification-script <name> <path> */
1373 ri = sentinelGetMasterByName(argv[1]);
1374 if (!ri) return "No such master with specified name.";
1375 if (access(argv[2],X_OK) == -1)
1376 return "Notification script seems non existing or non executable.";
1377 ri->notification_script = sdsnew(argv[2]);
1378 } else if (!strcasecmp(argv[0],"client-reconfig-script") && argc == 3) {
1379 /* client-reconfig-script <name> <path> */
1380 ri = sentinelGetMasterByName(argv[1]);
1381 if (!ri) return "No such master with specified name.";
1382 if (access(argv[2],X_OK) == -1)
1383 return "Client reconfiguration script seems non existing or "
1384 "non executable.";
1385 ri->client_reconfig_script = sdsnew(argv[2]);
1386 } else if (!strcasecmp(argv[0],"auth-pass") && argc == 3) {
1387 /* auth-pass <name> <password> */
1388 ri = sentinelGetMasterByName(argv[1]);
1389 if (!ri) return "No such master with specified name.";
1390 ri->auth_pass = sdsnew(argv[2]);
1391 } else if (!strcasecmp(argv[0],"current-epoch") && argc == 2) {
1392 /* current-epoch <epoch> */
1393 unsigned long long current_epoch = strtoull(argv[1],NULL,10);
1394 if (current_epoch > sentinel.current_epoch)
1395 sentinel.current_epoch = current_epoch;
1396 } else if (!strcasecmp(argv[0],"config-epoch") && argc == 3) {
1397 /* config-epoch <name> <epoch> */
1398 ri = sentinelGetMasterByName(argv[1]);
1399 if (!ri) return "No such master with specified name.";
1400 ri->config_epoch = strtoull(argv[2],NULL,10);
1401 /* The following update of current_epoch is not really useful as
1402 * now the current epoch is persisted on the config file, but
1403 * we leave this check here for redundancy. */
1404 if (ri->config_epoch > sentinel.current_epoch)
1405 sentinel.current_epoch = ri->config_epoch;
1406 } else if (!strcasecmp(argv[0],"leader-epoch") && argc == 3) {
1407 /* leader-epoch <name> <epoch> */
1408 ri = sentinelGetMasterByName(argv[1]);
1409 if (!ri) return "No such master with specified name.";
1410 ri->leader_epoch = strtoull(argv[2],NULL,10);
1411 } else if (!strcasecmp(argv[0],"known-slave") && argc == 4) {
1412 sentinelRedisInstance *slave;
1413
1414 /* known-slave <name> <ip> <port> */
1415 ri = sentinelGetMasterByName(argv[1]);
1416 if (!ri) return "No such master with specified name.";
1417 if ((slave = createSentinelRedisInstance(NULL,SRI_SLAVE,argv[2],
1418 atoi(argv[3]), ri->quorum, ri)) == NULL)
1419 {
1420 return "Wrong hostname or port for slave.";
1421 }
1422 } else if (!strcasecmp(argv[0],"known-sentinel") &&
1423 (argc == 4 || argc == 5)) {
1424 sentinelRedisInstance *si;
1425
1426 /* known-sentinel <name> <ip> <port> [runid] */
1427 ri = sentinelGetMasterByName(argv[1]);
1428 if (!ri) return "No such master with specified name.";
1429 if ((si = createSentinelRedisInstance(NULL,SRI_SENTINEL,argv[2],
1430 atoi(argv[3]), ri->quorum, ri)) == NULL)
1431 {
1432 return "Wrong hostname or port for sentinel.";
1433 }
1434 if (argc == 5) si->runid = sdsnew(argv[4]);
1435 } else if (!strcasecmp(argv[0],"announce-ip") && argc == 2) {
1436 /* announce-ip <ip-address> */
1437 if (strlen(argv[1]))
1438 sentinel.announce_ip = sdsnew(argv[1]);
1439 } else if (!strcasecmp(argv[0],"announce-port") && argc == 2) {
1440 /* announce-port <port> */
1441 sentinel.announce_port = atoi(argv[1]);
1442 } else {
1443 return "Unrecognized sentinel configuration statement.";
1444 }
1445 return NULL;
1446}
1447
1448/* Implements CONFIG REWRITE for "sentinel" option.
1449 * This is used not just to rewrite the configuration given by the user
1450 * (the configured masters) but also in order to retain the state of
1451 * Sentinel across restarts: config epoch of masters, associated slaves
1452 * and sentinel instances, and so forth. */
1453void rewriteConfigSentinelOption(struct rewriteConfigState *state) {
1454 dictIterator *di, *di2;
1455 dictEntry *de;
1456 sds line;
1457
1458 /* For every master emit a "sentinel monitor" config entry. */
1459 di = dictGetIterator(sentinel.masters);
1460 while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
1461 sentinelRedisInstance *master, *ri;
1462 sentinelAddr *master_addr;
1463
1464 /* sentinel monitor */
1465 master = dictGetVal(de);
1466 master_addr = sentinelGetCurrentMasterAddress(master);
1467 line = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),"sentinel monitor %s %s %d %d",
1468 master->name, master_addr->ip, master_addr->port,
1469 master->quorum);
1470 rewriteConfigRewriteLine(state,"sentinel",line,1);
1471
1472 /* sentinel down-after-milliseconds */
1473 if (master->down_after_period != SENTINEL_DEFAULT_DOWN_AFTER) {
1474 line = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),
1475 "sentinel down-after-milliseconds %s %ld",
1476 master->name, (long) master->down_after_period);
1477 rewriteConfigRewriteLine(state,"sentinel",line,1);
1478 }
1479
1480 /* sentinel failover-timeout */
1481 if (master->failover_timeout != SENTINEL_DEFAULT_FAILOVER_TIMEOUT) {
1482 line = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),
1483 "sentinel failover-timeout %s %ld",
1484 master->name, (long) master->failover_timeout);
1485 rewriteConfigRewriteLine(state,"sentinel",line,1);
1486 }
1487
1488 /* sentinel parallel-syncs */
1489 if (master->parallel_syncs != SENTINEL_DEFAULT_PARALLEL_SYNCS) {
1490 line = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),
1491 "sentinel parallel-syncs %s %d",
1492 master->name, master->parallel_syncs);
1493 rewriteConfigRewriteLine(state,"sentinel",line,1);
1494 }
1495
1496 /* sentinel notification-script */
1497 if (master->notification_script) {
1498 line = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),
1499 "sentinel notification-script %s %s",
1500 master->name, master->notification_script);
1501 rewriteConfigRewriteLine(state,"sentinel",line,1);
1502 }
1503
1504 /* sentinel client-reconfig-script */
1505 if (master->client_reconfig_script) {
1506 line = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),
1507 "sentinel client-reconfig-script %s %s",
1508 master->name, master->client_reconfig_script);
1509 rewriteConfigRewriteLine(state,"sentinel",line,1);
1510 }
1511
1512 /* sentinel auth-pass */
1513 if (master->auth_pass) {
1514 line = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),
1515 "sentinel auth-pass %s %s",
1516 master->name, master->auth_pass);
1517 rewriteConfigRewriteLine(state,"sentinel",line,1);
1518 }
1519
1520 /* sentinel config-epoch */
1521 line = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),
1522 "sentinel config-epoch %s %llu",
1523 master->name, (unsigned long long) master->config_epoch);
1524 rewriteConfigRewriteLine(state,"sentinel",line,1);
1525
1526 /* sentinel leader-epoch */
1527 line = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),
1528 "sentinel leader-epoch %s %llu",
1529 master->name, (unsigned long long) master->leader_epoch);
1530 rewriteConfigRewriteLine(state,"sentinel",line,1);
1531
1532 /* sentinel known-slave */
1533 di2 = dictGetIterator(master->slaves);
1534 while((de = dictNext(di2)) != NULL) {
1535 sentinelAddr *slave_addr;
1536
1537 ri = dictGetVal(de);
1538 slave_addr = ri->addr;
1539
1540 /* If master_addr (obtained using sentinelGetCurrentMasterAddress()
1541 * so it may be the address of the promoted slave) is equal to this
1542 * slave's address, a failover is in progress and the slave was
1543 * already successfully promoted. So as the address of this slave
1544 * we use the old master address instead. */
1545 if (sentinelAddrIsEqual(slave_addr,master_addr))
1546 slave_addr = master->addr;
1547 line = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),
1548 "sentinel known-slave %s %s %d",
1549 master->name, ri->addr->ip, ri->addr->port);
1550 rewriteConfigRewriteLine(state,"sentinel",line,1);
1551 }
1552 dictReleaseIterator(di2);
1553
1554 /* sentinel known-sentinel */
1555 di2 = dictGetIterator(master->sentinels);
1556 while((de = dictNext(di2)) != NULL) {
1557 ri = dictGetVal(de);
1558 line = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),
1559 "sentinel known-sentinel %s %s %d%s%s",
1560 master->name, ri->addr->ip, ri->addr->port,
1561 ri->runid ? " " : "",
1562 ri->runid ? ri->runid : "");
1563 rewriteConfigRewriteLine(state,"sentinel",line,1);
1564 }
1565 dictReleaseIterator(di2);
1566 }
1567
1568 /* sentinel current-epoch is a global state valid for all the masters. */
1569 line = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),
1570 "sentinel current-epoch %llu", (unsigned long long) sentinel.current_epoch);
1571 rewriteConfigRewriteLine(state,"sentinel",line,1);
1572
1573 /* sentinel announce-ip. */
1574 if (sentinel.announce_ip) {
1575 line = sdsnew("sentinel announce-ip ");
1576 line = sdscatrepr(line, sentinel.announce_ip, sdslen(sentinel.announce_ip));
1577 rewriteConfigRewriteLine(state,"sentinel",line,1);
1578 }
1579
1580 /* sentinel announce-port. */
1581 if (sentinel.announce_port) {
1582 line = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),"sentinel announce-port %d",
1583 sentinel.announce_port);
1584 rewriteConfigRewriteLine(state,"sentinel",line,1);
1585 }
1586
1587 dictReleaseIterator(di);
1588}
1589
1590/* This function uses the config rewriting Redis engine in order to persist
1591 * the state of the Sentinel in the current configuration file.
1592 *
1593 * Before returning the function calls fsync() against the generated
1594 * configuration file to make sure changes are committed to disk.
1595 *
1596 * On failure the function logs a warning on the Redis log. */
1597void sentinelFlushConfig(void) {
1598 int fd = -1;
1599 int saved_hz = server.hz;
1600 int rewrite_status;
1601
1602 server.hz = REDIS_DEFAULT_HZ;
1603 rewrite_status = rewriteConfig(server.configfile);
1604 server.hz = saved_hz;
1605
1606 if (rewrite_status == -1) goto werr;
1607 if ((fd = open(server.configfile,O_RDONLY)) == -1) goto werr;
1608 if (fsync(fd) == -1) goto werr;
1609 if (close(fd) == EOF) goto werr;
1610 return;
1611
1612werr:
1613 if (fd != -1) close(fd);
1614 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,"WARNING: Sentinel was not able to save the new configuration on disk!!!: %s", strerror(errno));
1615}
1616
1617/* ====================== hiredis connection handling ======================= */
1618
1619/* Completely disconnect a hiredis link from an instance. */
1620void sentinelKillLink(sentinelRedisInstance *ri, redisAsyncContext *c) {
1621 if (ri->cc == c) {
1622 ri->cc = NULL;
1623 ri->pending_commands = 0;
1624 }
1625 if (ri->pc == c) ri->pc = NULL;
1626 c->data = NULL;
1627 ri->flags |= SRI_DISCONNECTED;
1628 redisAsyncFree(c);
1629}
1630
1631/* This function takes a hiredis context that is in an error condition
1632 * and make sure to mark the instance as disconnected performing the
1633 * cleanup needed.
1634 *
1635 * Note: we don't free the hiredis context as hiredis will do it for us
1636 * for async connections. */
1637void sentinelDisconnectInstanceFromContext(const redisAsyncContext *c) {
1638 sentinelRedisInstance *ri = c->data;
1639 int pubsub;
1640
1641 if (ri == NULL) return; /* The instance no longer exists. */
1642
1643 pubsub = (ri->pc == c);
1644 sentinelEvent(REDIS_DEBUG, pubsub ? "-pubsub-link" : "-cmd-link", ri,
1645 "%@ #%s", c->errstr);
1646 if (pubsub)
1647 ri->pc = NULL;
1648 else
1649 ri->cc = NULL;
1650 ri->flags |= SRI_DISCONNECTED;
1651}
1652
1653void sentinelLinkEstablishedCallback(const redisAsyncContext *c, int status) {
1654 if (status != REDIS_OK) {
1655 sentinelDisconnectInstanceFromContext(c);
1656 } else {
1657 sentinelRedisInstance *ri = c->data;
1658 int pubsub = (ri->pc == c);
1659
1660 sentinelEvent(REDIS_DEBUG, pubsub ? "+pubsub-link" : "+cmd-link", ri,
1661 "%@");
1662 }
1663}
1664
1665void sentinelDisconnectCallback(const redisAsyncContext *c, int status) {
1666 REDIS_NOTUSED(status);
1667 sentinelDisconnectInstanceFromContext(c);
1668}
1669
1670/* Send the AUTH command with the specified master password if needed.
1671 * Note that for slaves the password set for the master is used.
1672 *
1673 * We don't check at all if the command was successfully transmitted
1674 * to the instance as if it fails Sentinel will detect the instance down,
1675 * will disconnect and reconnect the link and so forth. */
1676void sentinelSendAuthIfNeeded(sentinelRedisInstance *ri, redisAsyncContext *c) {
1677 char *auth_pass = (ri->flags & SRI_MASTER) ? ri->auth_pass :
1678 ri->master->auth_pass;
1679
1680 if (auth_pass) {
1681 if (redisAsyncCommand(c, sentinelDiscardReplyCallback, NULL, "AUTH %s",
1682 auth_pass) == REDIS_OK) ri->pending_commands++;
1683 }
1684}
1685
1686/* Use CLIENT SETNAME to name the connection in the Redis instance as
1687 * sentinel-<first_8_chars_of_runid>-<connection_type>
1688 * The connection type is "cmd" or "pubsub" as specified by 'type'.
1689 *
1690 * This makes it possible to list all the sentinel instances connected
1691 * to a Redis servewr with CLIENT LIST, grepping for a specific name format. */
1692void sentinelSetClientName(sentinelRedisInstance *ri, redisAsyncContext *c, char *type) {
1693 char name[64];
1694
1695 snprintf(name,sizeof(name),"sentinel-%.8s-%s",server.runid,type);
1696 if (redisAsyncCommand(c, sentinelDiscardReplyCallback, NULL,
1697 "CLIENT SETNAME %s", name) == REDIS_OK)
1698 {
1699 ri->pending_commands++;
1700 }
1701}
1702
1703/* Create the async connections for the specified instance if the instance
1704 * is disconnected. Note that the SRI_DISCONNECTED flag is set even if just
1705 * one of the two links (commands and pub/sub) is missing. */
1706void sentinelReconnectInstance(sentinelRedisInstance *ri) {
1707 if (!(ri->flags & SRI_DISCONNECTED)) return;
1708
1709 /* Commands connection. */
1710 if (ri->cc == NULL) {
1711 ri->cc = redisAsyncConnectBind(ri->addr->ip,ri->addr->port,REDIS_BIND_ADDR);
1712 if (ri->cc->err) {
1713 sentinelEvent(REDIS_DEBUG,"-cmd-link-reconnection",ri,"%@ #%s",
1714 ri->cc->errstr);
1715 sentinelKillLink(ri,ri->cc);
1716 } else {
1717 ri->cc_conn_time = mstime();
1718 ri->cc->data = ri;
1719 redisAeAttach(server.el,ri->cc);
1720 redisAsyncSetConnectCallback(ri->cc,
1721 sentinelLinkEstablishedCallback);
1722 redisAsyncSetDisconnectCallback(ri->cc,
1723 sentinelDisconnectCallback);
1724 sentinelSendAuthIfNeeded(ri,ri->cc);
1725 sentinelSetClientName(ri,ri->cc,"cmd");
1726
1727 /* Send a PING ASAP when reconnecting. */
1728 sentinelSendPing(ri);
1729 }
1730 }
1731 /* Pub / Sub */
1732 if ((ri->flags & (SRI_MASTER|SRI_SLAVE)) && ri->pc == NULL) {
1733 ri->pc = redisAsyncConnectBind(ri->addr->ip,ri->addr->port,REDIS_BIND_ADDR);
1734 if (ri->pc->err) {
1735 sentinelEvent(REDIS_DEBUG,"-pubsub-link-reconnection",ri,"%@ #%s",
1736 ri->pc->errstr);
1737 sentinelKillLink(ri,ri->pc);
1738 } else {
1739 int retval;
1740
1741 ri->pc_conn_time = mstime();
1742 ri->pc->data = ri;
1743 redisAeAttach(server.el,ri->pc);
1744 redisAsyncSetConnectCallback(ri->pc,
1745 sentinelLinkEstablishedCallback);
1746 redisAsyncSetDisconnectCallback(ri->pc,
1747 sentinelDisconnectCallback);
1748 sentinelSendAuthIfNeeded(ri,ri->pc);
1749 sentinelSetClientName(ri,ri->pc,"pubsub");
1750 /* Now we subscribe to the Sentinels "Hello" channel. */
1751 retval = redisAsyncCommand(ri->pc,
1752 sentinelReceiveHelloMessages, NULL, "SUBSCRIBE %s",
1753 SENTINEL_HELLO_CHANNEL);
1754 if (retval != REDIS_OK) {
1755 /* If we can't subscribe, the Pub/Sub connection is useless
1756 * and we can simply disconnect it and try again. */
1757 sentinelKillLink(ri,ri->pc);
1758 return;
1759 }
1760 }
1761 }
1762 /* Clear the DISCONNECTED flags only if we have both the connections
1763 * (or just the commands connection if this is a sentinel instance). */
1764 if (ri->cc && (ri->flags & SRI_SENTINEL || ri->pc))
1765 ri->flags &= ~SRI_DISCONNECTED;
1766}
1767
1768/* ======================== Redis instances pinging ======================== */
1769
1770/* Return true if master looks "sane", that is:
1771 * 1) It is actually a master in the current configuration.
1772 * 2) It reports itself as a master.
1773 * 3) It is not SDOWN or ODOWN.
1774 * 4) We obtained last INFO no more than two times the INFO period time ago. */
1775int sentinelMasterLooksSane(sentinelRedisInstance *master) {
1776 return
1777 master->flags & SRI_MASTER &&
1778 master->role_reported == SRI_MASTER &&
1779 (master->flags & (SRI_S_DOWN|SRI_O_DOWN)) == 0 &&
1780 (mstime() - master->info_refresh) < SENTINEL_INFO_PERIOD*2;
1781}
1782
1783/* Process the INFO output from masters. */
1784void sentinelRefreshInstanceInfo(sentinelRedisInstance *ri, const char *info) {
1785 sds *lines;
1786 int numlines, j;
1787 int role = 0;
1788
1789 /* The following fields must be reset to a given value in the case they
1790 * are not found at all in the INFO output. */
1791 ri->master_link_down_time = 0;
1792
1793 /* Process line by line. */
1794 lines = sdssplitlen(info,strlen(info),"\r\n",2,&numlines);
1795 for (j = 0; j < numlines; j++) {
1796 sentinelRedisInstance *slave;
1797 sds l = lines[j];
1798
1799 /* run_id:<40 hex chars>*/
1800 if (sdslen(l) >= 47 && !memcmp(l,"run_id:",7)) {
1801 if (ri->runid == NULL) {
1802 ri->runid = sdsnewlen(l+7,40);
1803 } else {
1804 if (strncmp(ri->runid,l+7,40) != 0) {
1805 sentinelEvent(REDIS_NOTICE,"+reboot",ri,"%@");
1806 sdsfree(ri->runid);
1807 ri->runid = sdsnewlen(l+7,40);
1808 }
1809 }
1810 }
1811
1812 /* old versions: slave0:<ip>,<port>,<state>
1813 * new versions: slave0:ip=127.0.0.1,port=9999,... */
1814 if ((ri->flags & SRI_MASTER) &&
1815 sdslen(l) >= 7 &&
1816 !memcmp(l,"slave",5) && isdigit(l[5]))
1817 {
1818 char *ip, *port, *end;
1819
1820 if (strstr(l,"ip=") == NULL) {
1821 /* Old format. */
1822 ip = strchr(l,':'); if (!ip) continue;
1823 ip++; /* Now ip points to start of ip address. */
1824 port = strchr(ip,','); if (!port) continue;
1825 *port = '\0'; /* nul term for easy access. */
1826 port++; /* Now port points to start of port number. */
1827 end = strchr(port,','); if (!end) continue;
1828 *end = '\0'; /* nul term for easy access. */
1829 } else {
1830 /* New format. */
1831 ip = strstr(l,"ip="); if (!ip) continue;
1832 ip += 3; /* Now ip points to start of ip address. */
1833 port = strstr(l,"port="); if (!port) continue;
1834 port += 5; /* Now port points to start of port number. */
1835 /* Nul term both fields for easy access. */
1836 end = strchr(ip,','); if (end) *end = '\0';
1837 end = strchr(port,','); if (end) *end = '\0';
1838 }
1839
1840 /* Check if we already have this slave into our table,
1841 * otherwise add it. */
1842 if (sentinelRedisInstanceLookupSlave(ri,ip,atoi(port)) == NULL) {
1843 if ((slave = createSentinelRedisInstance(NULL,SRI_SLAVE,ip,
1844 atoi(port), ri->quorum, ri)) != NULL)
1845 {
1846 sentinelEvent(REDIS_NOTICE,"+slave",slave,"%@");
1847 }
1848 }
1849 }
1850
1851 /* master_link_down_since_seconds:<seconds> */
1852 if (sdslen(l) >= 32 &&
1853 !memcmp(l,"master_link_down_since_seconds",30))
1854 {
1855 ri->master_link_down_time = strtoll(l+31,NULL,10)*1000;
1856 }
1857
1858 /* role:<role> */
1859 if (!memcmp(l,"role:master",11)) role = SRI_MASTER;
1860 else if (!memcmp(l,"role:slave",10)) role = SRI_SLAVE;
1861
1862 if (role == SRI_SLAVE) {
1863 /* master_host:<host> */
1864 if (sdslen(l) >= 12 && !memcmp(l,"master_host:",12)) {
1865 if (ri->slave_master_host == NULL ||
1866 strcasecmp(l+12,ri->slave_master_host))
1867 {
1868 sdsfree(ri->slave_master_host);
1869 ri->slave_master_host = sdsnew(l+12);
1870 ri->slave_conf_change_time = mstime();
1871 }
1872 }
1873
1874 /* master_port:<port> */
1875 if (sdslen(l) >= 12 && !memcmp(l,"master_port:",12)) {
1876 int slave_master_port = atoi(l+12);
1877
1878 if (ri->slave_master_port != slave_master_port) {
1879 ri->slave_master_port = slave_master_port;
1880 ri->slave_conf_change_time = mstime();
1881 }
1882 }
1883
1884 /* master_link_status:<status> */
1885 if (sdslen(l) >= 19 && !memcmp(l,"master_link_status:",19)) {
1886 ri->slave_master_link_status =
1887 (strcasecmp(l+19,"up") == 0) ?
1888 SENTINEL_MASTER_LINK_STATUS_UP :
1889 SENTINEL_MASTER_LINK_STATUS_DOWN;
1890 }
1891
1892 /* slave_priority:<priority> */
1893 if (sdslen(l) >= 15 && !memcmp(l,"slave_priority:",15))
1894 ri->slave_priority = atoi(l+15);
1895
1896 /* slave_repl_offset:<offset> */
1897 if (sdslen(l) >= 18 && !memcmp(l,"slave_repl_offset:",18))
1898 ri->slave_repl_offset = strtoull(l+18,NULL,10);
1899 }
1900 }
1901 ri->info_refresh = mstime();
1902 sdsfreesplitres(lines,numlines);
1903
1904 /* ---------------------------- Acting half -----------------------------
1905 * Some things will not happen if sentinel.tilt is true, but some will
1906 * still be processed. */
1907
1908 /* Remember when the role changed. */
1909 if (role != ri->role_reported) {
1910 ri->role_reported_time = mstime();
1911 ri->role_reported = role;
1912 if (role == SRI_SLAVE) ri->slave_conf_change_time = mstime();
1913 /* Log the event with +role-change if the new role is coherent or
1914 * with -role-change if there is a mismatch with the current config. */
1915 sentinelEvent(REDIS_VERBOSE,
1916 ((ri->flags & (SRI_MASTER|SRI_SLAVE)) == role) ?
1917 "+role-change" : "-role-change",
1918 ri, "%@ new reported role is %s",
1919 role == SRI_MASTER ? "master" : "slave",
1920 ri->flags & SRI_MASTER ? "master" : "slave");
1921 }
1922
1923 /* None of the following conditions are processed when in tilt mode, so
1924 * return asap. */
1925 if (sentinel.tilt) return;
1926
1927 /* Handle master -> slave role switch. */
1928 if ((ri->flags & SRI_MASTER) && role == SRI_SLAVE) {
1929 /* Nothing to do, but masters claiming to be slaves are
1930 * considered to be unreachable by Sentinel, so eventually
1931 * a failover will be triggered. */
1932 }
1933
1934 /* Handle slave -> master role switch. */
1935 if ((ri->flags & SRI_SLAVE) && role == SRI_MASTER) {
1936 /* If this is a promoted slave we can change state to the
1937 * failover state machine. */
1938 if ((ri->flags & SRI_PROMOTED) &&
1939 (ri->master->flags & SRI_FAILOVER_IN_PROGRESS) &&
1940 (ri->master->failover_state ==
1941 SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_WAIT_PROMOTION))
1942 {
1943 /* Now that we are sure the slave was reconfigured as a master
1944 * set the master configuration epoch to the epoch we won the
1945 * election to perform this failover. This will force the other
1946 * Sentinels to update their config (assuming there is not
1947 * a newer one already available). */
1948 ri->master->config_epoch = ri->master->failover_epoch;
1949 ri->master->failover_state = SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_RECONF_SLAVES;
1950 ri->master->failover_state_change_time = mstime();
1951 sentinelFlushConfig();
1952 sentinelEvent(REDIS_WARNING,"+promoted-slave",ri,"%@");
1953 sentinelEvent(REDIS_WARNING,"+failover-state-reconf-slaves",
1954 ri->master,"%@");
1955 sentinelCallClientReconfScript(ri->master,SENTINEL_LEADER,
1956 "start",ri->master->addr,ri->addr);
1957 sentinelForceHelloUpdateForMaster(ri->master);
1958 } else {
1959 /* A slave turned into a master. We want to force our view and
1960 * reconfigure as slave. Wait some time after the change before
1961 * going forward, to receive new configs if any. */
1962 mstime_t wait_time = SENTINEL_PUBLISH_PERIOD*4;
1963
1964 if (!(ri->flags & SRI_PROMOTED) &&
1965 sentinelMasterLooksSane(ri->master) &&
1966 sentinelRedisInstanceNoDownFor(ri,wait_time) &&
1967 mstime() - ri->role_reported_time > wait_time)
1968 {
1969 int retval = sentinelSendSlaveOf(ri,
1970 ri->master->addr->ip,
1971 ri->master->addr->port);
1972 if (retval == REDIS_OK)
1973 sentinelEvent(REDIS_NOTICE,"+convert-to-slave",ri,"%@");
1974 }
1975 }
1976 }
1977
1978 /* Handle slaves replicating to a different master address. */
1979 if ((ri->flags & SRI_SLAVE) &&
1980 role == SRI_SLAVE &&
1981 (ri->slave_master_port != ri->master->addr->port ||
1982 strcasecmp(ri->slave_master_host,ri->master->addr->ip)))
1983 {
1984 mstime_t wait_time = ri->master->failover_timeout;
1985
1986 /* Make sure the master is sane before reconfiguring this instance
1987 * into a slave. */
1988 if (sentinelMasterLooksSane(ri->master) &&
1989 sentinelRedisInstanceNoDownFor(ri,wait_time) &&
1990 mstime() - ri->slave_conf_change_time > wait_time)
1991 {
1992 int retval = sentinelSendSlaveOf(ri,
1993 ri->master->addr->ip,
1994 ri->master->addr->port);
1995 if (retval == REDIS_OK)
1996 sentinelEvent(REDIS_NOTICE,"+fix-slave-config",ri,"%@");
1997 }
1998 }
1999
2000 /* Detect if the slave that is in the process of being reconfigured
2001 * changed state. */
2002 if ((ri->flags & SRI_SLAVE) && role == SRI_SLAVE &&
2003 (ri->flags & (SRI_RECONF_SENT|SRI_RECONF_INPROG)))
2004 {
2005 /* SRI_RECONF_SENT -> SRI_RECONF_INPROG. */
2006 if ((ri->flags & SRI_RECONF_SENT) &&
2007 ri->slave_master_host &&
2008 strcmp(ri->slave_master_host,
2009 ri->master->promoted_slave->addr->ip) == 0 &&
2010 ri->slave_master_port == ri->master->promoted_slave->addr->port)
2011 {
2012 ri->flags &= ~SRI_RECONF_SENT;
2013 ri->flags |= SRI_RECONF_INPROG;
2014 sentinelEvent(REDIS_NOTICE,"+slave-reconf-inprog",ri,"%@");
2015 }
2016
2017 /* SRI_RECONF_INPROG -> SRI_RECONF_DONE */
2018 if ((ri->flags & SRI_RECONF_INPROG) &&
2019 ri->slave_master_link_status == SENTINEL_MASTER_LINK_STATUS_UP)
2020 {
2021 ri->flags &= ~SRI_RECONF_INPROG;
2022 ri->flags |= SRI_RECONF_DONE;
2023 sentinelEvent(REDIS_NOTICE,"+slave-reconf-done",ri,"%@");
2024 }
2025 }
2026}
2027
2028void sentinelInfoReplyCallback(redisAsyncContext *c, void *reply, void *privdata) {
2029 sentinelRedisInstance *ri = c->data;
2030 redisReply *r;
2031 REDIS_NOTUSED(privdata);
2032
2033 if (ri) ri->pending_commands--;
2034 if (!reply || !ri) return;
2035 r = reply;
2036
2037 if (r->type == REDIS_REPLY_STRING) {
2038 sentinelRefreshInstanceInfo(ri,r->str);
2039 }
2040}
2041
2042/* Just discard the reply. We use this when we are not monitoring the return
2043 * value of the command but its effects directly. */
2044void sentinelDiscardReplyCallback(redisAsyncContext *c, void *reply, void *privdata) {
2045 sentinelRedisInstance *ri = c->data;
2046 REDIS_NOTUSED(reply);
2047 REDIS_NOTUSED(privdata);
2048
2049 if (ri) ri->pending_commands--;
2050}
2051
2052void sentinelPingReplyCallback(redisAsyncContext *c, void *reply, void *privdata) {
2053 sentinelRedisInstance *ri = c->data;
2054 redisReply *r;
2055 REDIS_NOTUSED(privdata);
2056
2057 if (ri) ri->pending_commands--;
2058 if (!reply || !ri) return;
2059 r = reply;
2060
2061 if (r->type == REDIS_REPLY_STATUS ||
2062 r->type == REDIS_REPLY_ERROR) {
2063 /* Update the "instance available" field only if this is an
2064 * acceptable reply. */
2065 if (strncmp(r->str,"PONG",4) == 0 ||
2066 strncmp(r->str,"LOADING",7) == 0 ||
2067 strncmp(r->str,"MASTERDOWN",10) == 0)
2068 {
2069 ri->last_avail_time = mstime();
2070 ri->last_ping_time = 0; /* Flag the pong as received. */
2071 } else {
2072 /* Send a SCRIPT KILL command if the instance appears to be
2073 * down because of a busy script. */
2074 if (strncmp(r->str,"BUSY",4) == 0 &&
2075 (ri->flags & SRI_S_DOWN) &&
2076 !(ri->flags & SRI_SCRIPT_KILL_SENT))
2077 {
2078 if (redisAsyncCommand(ri->cc,
2079 sentinelDiscardReplyCallback, NULL,
2080 "SCRIPT KILL") == REDIS_OK)
2081 ri->pending_commands++;
2082 ri->flags |= SRI_SCRIPT_KILL_SENT;
2083 }
2084 }
2085 }
2086 ri->last_pong_time = mstime();
2087}
2088
2089/* This is called when we get the reply about the PUBLISH command we send
2090 * to the master to advertise this sentinel. */
2091void sentinelPublishReplyCallback(redisAsyncContext *c, void *reply, void *privdata) {
2092 sentinelRedisInstance *ri = c->data;
2093 redisReply *r;
2094 REDIS_NOTUSED(privdata);
2095
2096 if (ri) ri->pending_commands--;
2097 if (!reply || !ri) return;
2098 r = reply;
2099
2100 /* Only update pub_time if we actually published our message. Otherwise
2101 * we'll retry again in 100 milliseconds. */
2102 if (r->type != REDIS_REPLY_ERROR)
2103 ri->last_pub_time = mstime();
2104}
2105
2106/* Process an hello message received via Pub/Sub in master or slave instance,
2107 * or sent directly to this sentinel via the (fake) PUBLISH command of Sentinel.
2108 *
2109 * If the master name specified in the message is not known, the message is
2110 * discarded. */
2111void sentinelProcessHelloMessage(char *hello, int hello_len) {
2112 /* Format is composed of 8 tokens:
2113 * 0=ip,1=port,2=runid,3=current_epoch,4=master_name,
2114 * 5=master_ip,6=master_port,7=master_config_epoch. */
2115 int numtokens, port, removed, master_port;
2116 uint64_t current_epoch, master_config_epoch;
2117 char **token = sdssplitlen(hello, hello_len, ",", 1, &numtokens);
2118 sentinelRedisInstance *si, *master;
2119
2120 if (numtokens == 8) {
2121 /* Obtain a reference to the master this hello message is about */
2122 master = sentinelGetMasterByName(token[4]);
2123 if (!master) goto cleanup; /* Unknown master, skip the message. */
2124
2125 /* First, try to see if we already have this sentinel. */
2126 port = atoi(token[1]);
2127 master_port = atoi(token[6]);
2128 si = getSentinelRedisInstanceByAddrAndRunID(
2129 master->sentinels,token[0],port,token[2]);
2130 current_epoch = strtoull(token[3],NULL,10);
2131 master_config_epoch = strtoull(token[7],NULL,10);
2132
2133 if (!si) {
2134 /* If not, remove all the sentinels that have the same runid
2135 * OR the same ip/port, because it's either a restart or a
2136 * network topology change. */
2137 removed = removeMatchingSentinelsFromMaster(master,token[0],port,
2138 token[2]);
2139 if (removed) {
2140 sentinelEvent(REDIS_NOTICE,"-dup-sentinel",master,
2141 "%@ #duplicate of %s:%d or %s",
2142 token[0],port,token[2]);
2143 }
2144
2145 /* Add the new sentinel. */
2146 si = createSentinelRedisInstance(NULL,SRI_SENTINEL,
2147 token[0],port,master->quorum,master);
2148 if (si) {
2149 sentinelEvent(REDIS_NOTICE,"+sentinel",si,"%@");
2150 /* The runid is NULL after a new instance creation and
2151 * for Sentinels we don't have a later chance to fill it,
2152 * so do it now. */
2153 si->runid = sdsnew(token[2]);
2154 sentinelFlushConfig();
2155 }
2156 }
2157
2158 /* Update local current_epoch if received current_epoch is greater.*/
2159 if (current_epoch > sentinel.current_epoch) {
2160 sentinel.current_epoch = current_epoch;
2161 sentinelFlushConfig();
2162 sentinelEvent(REDIS_WARNING,"+new-epoch",master,"%llu",
2163 (unsigned long long) sentinel.current_epoch);
2164 }
2165
2166 /* Update master info if received configuration is newer. */
2167 if (master->config_epoch < master_config_epoch) {
2168 master->config_epoch = master_config_epoch;
2169 if (master_port != master->addr->port ||
2170 strcmp(master->addr->ip, token[5]))
2171 {
2172 sentinelAddr *old_addr;
2173
2174 sentinelEvent(REDIS_WARNING,"+config-update-from",si,"%@");
2175 sentinelEvent(REDIS_WARNING,"+switch-master",
2176 master,"%s %s %d %s %d",
2177 master->name,
2178 master->addr->ip, master->addr->port,
2179 token[5], master_port);
2180
2181 old_addr = dupSentinelAddr(master->addr);
2182 sentinelResetMasterAndChangeAddress(master, token[5], master_port);
2183 sentinelCallClientReconfScript(master,
2184 SENTINEL_OBSERVER,"start",
2185 old_addr,master->addr);
2186 releaseSentinelAddr(old_addr);
2187 }
2188 }
2189
2190 /* Update the state of the Sentinel. */
2191 if (si) si->last_hello_time = mstime();
2192 }
2193
2194cleanup:
2195 sdsfreesplitres(token,numtokens);
2196}
2197
2198
2199/* This is our Pub/Sub callback for the Hello channel. It's useful in order
2200 * to discover other sentinels attached at the same master. */
2201void sentinelReceiveHelloMessages(redisAsyncContext *c, void *reply, void *privdata) {
2202 sentinelRedisInstance *ri = c->data;
2203 redisReply *r;
2204 REDIS_NOTUSED(privdata);
2205
2206 if (!reply || !ri) return;
2207 r = reply;
2208
2209 /* Update the last activity in the pubsub channel. Note that since we
2210 * receive our messages as well this timestamp can be used to detect
2211 * if the link is probably disconnected even if it seems otherwise. */
2212 ri->pc_last_activity = mstime();
2213
2214 /* Sanity check in the reply we expect, so that the code that follows
2215 * can avoid to check for details. */
2216 if (r->type != REDIS_REPLY_ARRAY ||
2217 r->elements != 3 ||
2218 r->element[0]->type != REDIS_REPLY_STRING ||
2219 r->element[1]->type != REDIS_REPLY_STRING ||
2220 r->element[2]->type != REDIS_REPLY_STRING ||
2221 strcmp(r->element[0]->str,"message") != 0) return;
2222
2223 /* We are not interested in meeting ourselves */
2224 if (strstr(r->element[2]->str,server.runid) != NULL) return;
2225
2226 sentinelProcessHelloMessage(r->element[2]->str, r->element[2]->len);
2227}
2228
2229/* Send an "Hello" message via Pub/Sub to the specified 'ri' Redis
