2230 * instance in order to broadcast the current configuraiton for this
2231 * master, and to advertise the existence of this Sentinel at the same time.
2232 *
2233 * The message has the following format:
2234 *
2235 * sentinel_ip,sentinel_port,sentinel_runid,current_epoch,
2236 * master_name,master_ip,master_port,master_config_epoch.
2237 *
2238 * Returns REDIS_OK if the PUBLISH was queued correctly, otherwise
2239 * REDIS_ERR is returned. */
2240int sentinelSendHello(sentinelRedisInstance *ri) {
2241 char ip[REDIS_IP_STR_LEN];
2242 char payload[REDIS_IP_STR_LEN+1024];
2243 int retval;
2244 char *announce_ip;
2245 int announce_port;
2246 sentinelRedisInstance *master = (ri->flags & SRI_MASTER) ? ri : ri->master;
2247 sentinelAddr *master_addr = sentinelGetCurrentMasterAddress(master);
2248
2249 if (ri->flags & SRI_DISCONNECTED) return REDIS_ERR;
2250
2251 /* Use the specified announce address if specified, otherwise try to
2252 * obtain our own IP address. */
2253 if (sentinel.announce_ip) {
2254 announce_ip = sentinel.announce_ip;
2255 } else {
2256 if (anetSockName(ri->cc->c.fd,ip,sizeof(ip),NULL) == -1)
2257 return REDIS_ERR;
2258 announce_ip = ip;
2259 }
2260 announce_port = sentinel.announce_port ?
2261 sentinel.announce_port : server.port;
2262
2263 /* Format and send the Hello message. */
2264 snprintf(payload,sizeof(payload),
2265 "%s,%d,%s,%llu," /* Info about this sentinel. */
2266 "%s,%s,%d,%llu", /* Info about current master. */
2267 announce_ip, announce_port, server.runid,
2268 (unsigned long long) sentinel.current_epoch,
2269 /* --- */
2270 master->name,master_addr->ip,master_addr->port,
2271 (unsigned long long) master->config_epoch);
2272 retval = redisAsyncCommand(ri->cc,
2273 sentinelPublishReplyCallback, NULL, "PUBLISH %s %s",
2274 SENTINEL_HELLO_CHANNEL,payload);
2275 if (retval != REDIS_OK) return REDIS_ERR;
2276 ri->pending_commands++;
2277 return REDIS_OK;
2278}
2279
2280/* Reset last_pub_time in all the instances in the specified dictionary
2281 * in order to force the delivery of an Hello update ASAP. */
2282void sentinelForceHelloUpdateDictOfRedisInstances(dict *instances) {
2283 dictIterator *di;
2284 dictEntry *de;
2285
2286 di = dictGetSafeIterator(instances);
2287 while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
2288 sentinelRedisInstance *ri = dictGetVal(de);
2289 if (ri->last_pub_time >= (SENTINEL_PUBLISH_PERIOD+1))
2290 ri->last_pub_time -= (SENTINEL_PUBLISH_PERIOD+1);
2291 }
2292 dictReleaseIterator(di);
2293}
2294
2295/* This function forces the delivery of an "Hello" message (see
2296 * sentinelSendHello() top comment for further information) to all the Redis
2297 * and Sentinel instances related to the specified 'master'.
2298 *
2299 * It is technically not needed since we send an update to every instance
2300 * with a period of SENTINEL_PUBLISH_PERIOD milliseconds, however when a
2301 * Sentinel upgrades a configuration it is a good idea to deliever an update
2302 * to the other Sentinels ASAP. */
2303int sentinelForceHelloUpdateForMaster(sentinelRedisInstance *master) {
2304 if (!(master->flags & SRI_MASTER)) return REDIS_ERR;
2305 if (master->last_pub_time >= (SENTINEL_PUBLISH_PERIOD+1))
2306 master->last_pub_time -= (SENTINEL_PUBLISH_PERIOD+1);
2307 sentinelForceHelloUpdateDictOfRedisInstances(master->sentinels);
2308 sentinelForceHelloUpdateDictOfRedisInstances(master->slaves);
2309 return REDIS_OK;
2310}
2311
2312/* Send a PING to the specified instance and refresh the last_ping_time
2313 * if it is zero (that is, if we received a pong for the previous ping).
2314 *
2315 * On error zero is returned, and we can't consider the PING command
2316 * queued in the connection. */
2317int sentinelSendPing(sentinelRedisInstance *ri) {
2318 int retval = redisAsyncCommand(ri->cc,
2319 sentinelPingReplyCallback, NULL, "PING");
2320 if (retval == REDIS_OK) {
2321 ri->pending_commands++;
2322 /* We update the ping time only if we received the pong for
2323 * the previous ping, otherwise we are technically waiting
2324 * since the first ping that did not received a reply. */
2325 if (ri->last_ping_time == 0) ri->last_ping_time = mstime();
2326 return 1;
2327 } else {
2328 return 0;
2329 }
2330}
2331
2332/* Send periodic PING, INFO, and PUBLISH to the Hello channel to
2333 * the specified master or slave instance. */
2334void sentinelSendPeriodicCommands(sentinelRedisInstance *ri) {
2335 mstime_t now = mstime();
2336 mstime_t info_period, ping_period;
2337 int retval;
2338
2339 /* Return ASAP if we have already a PING or INFO already pending, or
2340 * in the case the instance is not properly connected. */
2341 if (ri->flags & SRI_DISCONNECTED) return;
2342
2343 /* For INFO, PING, PUBLISH that are not critical commands to send we
2344 * also have a limit of SENTINEL_MAX_PENDING_COMMANDS. We don't
2345 * want to use a lot of memory just because a link is not working
2346 * properly (note that anyway there is a redundant protection about this,
2347 * that is, the link will be disconnected and reconnected if a long
2348 * timeout condition is detected. */
2349 if (ri->pending_commands >= SENTINEL_MAX_PENDING_COMMANDS) return;
2350
2351 /* If this is a slave of a master in O_DOWN condition we start sending
2352 * it INFO every second, instead of the usual SENTINEL_INFO_PERIOD
2353 * period. In this state we want to closely monitor slaves in case they
2354 * are turned into masters by another Sentinel, or by the sysadmin. */
2355 if ((ri->flags & SRI_SLAVE) &&
2356 (ri->master->flags & (SRI_O_DOWN|SRI_FAILOVER_IN_PROGRESS))) {
2357 info_period = 1000;
2358 } else {
2359 info_period = SENTINEL_INFO_PERIOD;
2360 }
2361
2362 /* We ping instances every time the last received pong is older than
2363 * the configured 'down-after-milliseconds' time, but every second
2364 * anyway if 'down-after-milliseconds' is greater than 1 second. */
2365 ping_period = ri->down_after_period;
2366 if (ping_period > SENTINEL_PING_PERIOD) ping_period = SENTINEL_PING_PERIOD;
2367
2368 if ((ri->flags & SRI_SENTINEL) == 0 &&
2369 (ri->info_refresh == 0 ||
2370 (now - ri->info_refresh) > info_period))
2371 {
2372 /* Send INFO to masters and slaves, not sentinels. */
2373 retval = redisAsyncCommand(ri->cc,
2374 sentinelInfoReplyCallback, NULL, "INFO");
2375 if (retval == REDIS_OK) ri->pending_commands++;
2376 } else if ((now - ri->last_pong_time) > ping_period) {
2377 /* Send PING to all the three kinds of instances. */
2378 sentinelSendPing(ri);
2379 } else if ((now - ri->last_pub_time) > SENTINEL_PUBLISH_PERIOD) {
2380 /* PUBLISH hello messages to all the three kinds of instances. */
2381 sentinelSendHello(ri);
2382 }
2383}
2384
2385/* =========================== SENTINEL command ============================= */
2386
2387const char *sentinelFailoverStateStr(int state) {
2388 switch(state) {
2389 case SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_NONE: return "none";
2390 case SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_WAIT_START: return "wait_start";
2391 case SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_SELECT_SLAVE: return "select_slave";
2392 case SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_SEND_SLAVEOF_NOONE: return "send_slaveof_noone";
2393 case SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_WAIT_PROMOTION: return "wait_promotion";
2394 case SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_RECONF_SLAVES: return "reconf_slaves";
2395 case SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_UPDATE_CONFIG: return "update_config";
2396 default: return "unknown";
2397 }
2398}
2399
2400/* Redis instance to Redis protocol representation. */
2401void addReplySentinelRedisInstance(redisClient *c, sentinelRedisInstance *ri) {
2402 char *flags = sdsempty();
2403 void *mbl;
2404 int fields = 0;
2405
2406 mbl = addDeferredMultiBulkLength(c);
2407
2408 addReplyBulkCString(c,"name");
2409 addReplyBulkCString(c,ri->name);
2410 fields++;
2411
2412 addReplyBulkCString(c,"ip");
2413 addReplyBulkCString(c,ri->addr->ip);
2414 fields++;
2415
2416 addReplyBulkCString(c,"port");
2417 addReplyBulkLongLong(c,ri->addr->port);
2418 fields++;
2419
2420 addReplyBulkCString(c,"runid");
2421 addReplyBulkCString(c,ri->runid ? ri->runid : "");
2422 fields++;
2423
2424 addReplyBulkCString(c,"flags");
2425 if (ri->flags & SRI_S_DOWN) flags = sdscat(flags,"s_down,");
2426 if (ri->flags & SRI_O_DOWN) flags = sdscat(flags,"o_down,");
2427 if (ri->flags & SRI_MASTER) flags = sdscat(flags,"master,");
2428 if (ri->flags & SRI_SLAVE) flags = sdscat(flags,"slave,");
2429 if (ri->flags & SRI_SENTINEL) flags = sdscat(flags,"sentinel,");
2430 if (ri->flags & SRI_DISCONNECTED) flags = sdscat(flags,"disconnected,");
2431 if (ri->flags & SRI_MASTER_DOWN) flags = sdscat(flags,"master_down,");
2432 if (ri->flags & SRI_FAILOVER_IN_PROGRESS)
2433 flags = sdscat(flags,"failover_in_progress,");
2434 if (ri->flags & SRI_PROMOTED) flags = sdscat(flags,"promoted,");
2435 if (ri->flags & SRI_RECONF_SENT) flags = sdscat(flags,"reconf_sent,");
2436 if (ri->flags & SRI_RECONF_INPROG) flags = sdscat(flags,"reconf_inprog,");
2437 if (ri->flags & SRI_RECONF_DONE) flags = sdscat(flags,"reconf_done,");
2438
2439 if (sdslen(flags) != 0) sdsrange(flags,0,-2); /* remove last "," */
2440 addReplyBulkCString(c,flags);
2441 sdsfree(flags);
2442 fields++;
2443
2444 addReplyBulkCString(c,"pending-commands");
2445 addReplyBulkLongLong(c,ri->pending_commands);
2446 fields++;
2447
2448 if (ri->flags & SRI_FAILOVER_IN_PROGRESS) {
2449 addReplyBulkCString(c,"failover-state");
2450 addReplyBulkCString(c,(char*)sentinelFailoverStateStr(ri->failover_state));
2451 fields++;
2452 }
2453
2454 addReplyBulkCString(c,"last-ping-sent");
2455 addReplyBulkLongLong(c,
2456 ri->last_ping_time ? (mstime() - ri->last_ping_time) : 0);
2457 fields++;
2458
2459 addReplyBulkCString(c,"last-ok-ping-reply");
2460 addReplyBulkLongLong(c,mstime() - ri->last_avail_time);
2461 fields++;
2462
2463 addReplyBulkCString(c,"last-ping-reply");
2464 addReplyBulkLongLong(c,mstime() - ri->last_pong_time);
2465 fields++;
2466
2467 if (ri->flags & SRI_S_DOWN) {
2468 addReplyBulkCString(c,"s-down-time");
2469 addReplyBulkLongLong(c,mstime()-ri->s_down_since_time);
2470 fields++;
2471 }
2472
2473 if (ri->flags & SRI_O_DOWN) {
2474 addReplyBulkCString(c,"o-down-time");
2475 addReplyBulkLongLong(c,mstime()-ri->o_down_since_time);
2476 fields++;
2477 }
2478
2479 addReplyBulkCString(c,"down-after-milliseconds");
2480 addReplyBulkLongLong(c,ri->down_after_period);
2481 fields++;
2482
2483 /* Masters and Slaves */
2484 if (ri->flags & (SRI_MASTER|SRI_SLAVE)) {
2485 addReplyBulkCString(c,"info-refresh");
2486 addReplyBulkLongLong(c,mstime() - ri->info_refresh);
2487 fields++;
2488
2489 addReplyBulkCString(c,"role-reported");
2490 addReplyBulkCString(c, (ri->role_reported == SRI_MASTER) ? "master" :
2491 "slave");
2492 fields++;
2493
2494 addReplyBulkCString(c,"role-reported-time");
2495 addReplyBulkLongLong(c,mstime() - ri->role_reported_time);
2496 fields++;
2497 }
2498
2499 /* Only masters */
2500 if (ri->flags & SRI_MASTER) {
2501 addReplyBulkCString(c,"config-epoch");
2502 addReplyBulkLongLong(c,ri->config_epoch);
2503 fields++;
2504
2505 addReplyBulkCString(c,"num-slaves");
2506 addReplyBulkLongLong(c,dictSize(ri->slaves));
2507 fields++;
2508
2509 addReplyBulkCString(c,"num-other-sentinels");
2510 addReplyBulkLongLong(c,dictSize(ri->sentinels));
2511 fields++;
2512
2513 addReplyBulkCString(c,"quorum");
2514 addReplyBulkLongLong(c,ri->quorum);
2515 fields++;
2516
2517 addReplyBulkCString(c,"failover-timeout");
2518 addReplyBulkLongLong(c,ri->failover_timeout);
2519 fields++;
2520
2521 addReplyBulkCString(c,"parallel-syncs");
2522 addReplyBulkLongLong(c,ri->parallel_syncs);
2523 fields++;
2524
2525 if (ri->notification_script) {
2526 addReplyBulkCString(c,"notification-script");
2527 addReplyBulkCString(c,ri->notification_script);
2528 fields++;
2529 }
2530
2531 if (ri->client_reconfig_script) {
2532 addReplyBulkCString(c,"client-reconfig-script");
2533 addReplyBulkCString(c,ri->client_reconfig_script);
2534 fields++;
2535 }
2536 }
2537
2538 /* Only slaves */
2539 if (ri->flags & SRI_SLAVE) {
2540 addReplyBulkCString(c,"master-link-down-time");
2541 addReplyBulkLongLong(c,ri->master_link_down_time);
2542 fields++;
2543
2544 addReplyBulkCString(c,"master-link-status");
2545 addReplyBulkCString(c,
2546 (ri->slave_master_link_status == SENTINEL_MASTER_LINK_STATUS_UP) ?
2547 "ok" : "err");
2548 fields++;
2549
2550 addReplyBulkCString(c,"master-host");
2551 addReplyBulkCString(c,
2552 ri->slave_master_host ? ri->slave_master_host : "?");
2553 fields++;
2554
2555 addReplyBulkCString(c,"master-port");
2556 addReplyBulkLongLong(c,ri->slave_master_port);
2557 fields++;
2558
2559 addReplyBulkCString(c,"slave-priority");
2560 addReplyBulkLongLong(c,ri->slave_priority);
2561 fields++;
2562
2563 addReplyBulkCString(c,"slave-repl-offset");
2564 addReplyBulkLongLong(c,ri->slave_repl_offset);
2565 fields++;
2566 }
2567
2568 /* Only sentinels */
2569 if (ri->flags & SRI_SENTINEL) {
2570 addReplyBulkCString(c,"last-hello-message");
2571 addReplyBulkLongLong(c,mstime() - ri->last_hello_time);
2572 fields++;
2573
2574 addReplyBulkCString(c,"voted-leader");
2575 addReplyBulkCString(c,ri->leader ? ri->leader : "?");
2576 fields++;
2577
2578 addReplyBulkCString(c,"voted-leader-epoch");
2579 addReplyBulkLongLong(c,ri->leader_epoch);
2580 fields++;
2581 }
2582
2583 setDeferredMultiBulkLength(c,mbl,fields*2);
2584}
2585
2586/* Output a number of instances contained inside a dictionary as
2587 * Redis protocol. */
2588void addReplyDictOfRedisInstances(redisClient *c, dict *instances) {
2589 dictIterator *di;
2590 dictEntry *de;
2591
2592 di = dictGetIterator(instances);
2593 addReplyMultiBulkLen(c,dictSize(instances));
2594 while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
2595 sentinelRedisInstance *ri = dictGetVal(de);
2596
2597 addReplySentinelRedisInstance(c,ri);
2598 }
2599 dictReleaseIterator(di);
2600}
2601
2602/* Lookup the named master into sentinel.masters.
2603 * If the master is not found reply to the client with an error and returns
2604 * NULL. */
2605sentinelRedisInstance *sentinelGetMasterByNameOrReplyError(redisClient *c,
2606 robj *name)
2607{
2608 sentinelRedisInstance *ri;
2609
2610 ri = dictFetchValue(sentinel.masters,name->ptr);
2611 if (!ri) {
2612 addReplyError(c,"No such master with that name");
2613 return NULL;
2614 }
2615 return ri;
2616}
2617
2618void sentinelCommand(redisClient *c) {
2619 if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"masters")) {
2620 /* SENTINEL MASTERS */
2621 if (c->argc != 2) goto numargserr;
2622 addReplyDictOfRedisInstances(c,sentinel.masters);
2623 } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"master")) {
2624 /* SENTINEL MASTER <name> */
2625 sentinelRedisInstance *ri;
2626
2627 if (c->argc != 3) goto numargserr;
2628 if ((ri = sentinelGetMasterByNameOrReplyError(c,c->argv[2]))
2629 == NULL) return;
2630 addReplySentinelRedisInstance(c,ri);
2631 } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"slaves")) {
2632 /* SENTINEL SLAVES <master-name> */
2633 sentinelRedisInstance *ri;
2634
2635 if (c->argc != 3) goto numargserr;
2636 if ((ri = sentinelGetMasterByNameOrReplyError(c,c->argv[2])) == NULL)
2637 return;
2638 addReplyDictOfRedisInstances(c,ri->slaves);
2639 } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"sentinels")) {
2640 /* SENTINEL SENTINELS <master-name> */
2641 sentinelRedisInstance *ri;
2642
2643 if (c->argc != 3) goto numargserr;
2644 if ((ri = sentinelGetMasterByNameOrReplyError(c,c->argv[2])) == NULL)
2645 return;
2646 addReplyDictOfRedisInstances(c,ri->sentinels);
2647 } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"is-master-down-by-addr")) {
2648 /* SENTINEL IS-MASTER-DOWN-BY-ADDR <ip> <port> <current-epoch> <runid>*/
2649 sentinelRedisInstance *ri;
2650 long long req_epoch;
2651 uint64_t leader_epoch = 0;
2652 char *leader = NULL;
2653 long port;
2654 int isdown = 0;
2655
2656 if (c->argc != 6) goto numargserr;
2657 if (getLongFromObjectOrReply(c,c->argv[3],&port,NULL) != REDIS_OK ||
2658 getLongLongFromObjectOrReply(c,c->argv[4],&req_epoch,NULL)
2659 != REDIS_OK)
2660 return;
2661 ri = getSentinelRedisInstanceByAddrAndRunID(sentinel.masters,
2662 c->argv[2]->ptr,port,NULL);
2663
2664 /* It exists? Is actually a master? Is subjectively down? It's down.
2665 * Note: if we are in tilt mode we always reply with "0". */
2666 if (!sentinel.tilt && ri && (ri->flags & SRI_S_DOWN) &&
2667 (ri->flags & SRI_MASTER))
2668 isdown = 1;
2669
2670 /* Vote for the master (or fetch the previous vote) if the request
2671 * includes a runid, otherwise the sender is not seeking for a vote. */
2672 if (ri && ri->flags & SRI_MASTER && strcasecmp(c->argv[5]->ptr,"*")) {
2673 leader = sentinelVoteLeader(ri,(uint64_t)req_epoch,
2674 c->argv[5]->ptr,
2675 &leader_epoch);
2676 }
2677
2678 /* Reply with a three-elements multi-bulk reply:
2679 * down state, leader, vote epoch. */
2680 addReplyMultiBulkLen(c,3);
2681 addReply(c, isdown ? shared.cone : shared.czero);
2682 addReplyBulkCString(c, leader ? leader : "*");
2683 addReplyLongLong(c, (long long)leader_epoch);
2684 if (leader) sdsfree(leader);
2685 } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"reset")) {
2686 /* SENTINEL RESET <pattern> */
2687 if (c->argc != 3) goto numargserr;
2688 addReplyLongLong(c,sentinelResetMastersByPattern(c->argv[2]->ptr,SENTINEL_GENERATE_EVENT));
2689 } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"get-master-addr-by-name")) {
2690 /* SENTINEL GET-MASTER-ADDR-BY-NAME <master-name> */
2691 sentinelRedisInstance *ri;
2692
2693 if (c->argc != 3) goto numargserr;
2694 ri = sentinelGetMasterByName(c->argv[2]->ptr);
2695 if (ri == NULL) {
2696 addReply(c,shared.nullmultibulk);
2697 } else {
2698 sentinelAddr *addr = sentinelGetCurrentMasterAddress(ri);
2699
2700 addReplyMultiBulkLen(c,2);
2701 addReplyBulkCString(c,addr->ip);
2702 addReplyBulkLongLong(c,addr->port);
2703 }
2704 } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"failover")) {
2705 /* SENTINEL FAILOVER <master-name> */
2706 sentinelRedisInstance *ri;
2707
2708 if (c->argc != 3) goto numargserr;
2709 if ((ri = sentinelGetMasterByNameOrReplyError(c,c->argv[2])) == NULL)
2710 return;
2711 if (ri->flags & SRI_FAILOVER_IN_PROGRESS) {
2712 addReplySds(c,sdsnew("-INPROG Failover already in progress\r\n"));
2713 return;
2714 }
2715 if (sentinelSelectSlave(ri) == NULL) {
2716 addReplySds(c,sdsnew("-NOGOODSLAVE No suitable slave to promote\r\n"));
2717 return;
2718 }
2719 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,"Executing user requested FAILOVER of '%s'",
2720 ri->name);
2721 sentinelStartFailover(ri);
2722 ri->flags |= SRI_FORCE_FAILOVER;
2723 addReply(c,shared.ok);
2724 } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"pending-scripts")) {
2725 /* SENTINEL PENDING-SCRIPTS */
2726
2727 if (c->argc != 2) goto numargserr;
2728 sentinelPendingScriptsCommand(c);
2729 } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"monitor")) {
2730 /* SENTINEL MONITOR <name> <ip> <port> <quorum> */
2731 sentinelRedisInstance *ri;
2732 long quorum, port;
2733 char ip[REDIS_IP_STR_LEN];
2734
2735 if (c->argc != 6) goto numargserr;
2736 if (getLongFromObjectOrReply(c,c->argv[5],&quorum,"Invalid quorum")
2737 != REDIS_OK) return;
2738 if (getLongFromObjectOrReply(c,c->argv[4],&port,"Invalid port")
2739 != REDIS_OK) return;
2740 /* Make sure the IP field is actually a valid IP before passing it
2741 * to createSentinelRedisInstance(), otherwise we may trigger a
2742 * DNS lookup at runtime. */
2743 if (anetResolveIP(NULL,c->argv[3]->ptr,ip,sizeof(ip)) == ANET_ERR) {
2744 addReplyError(c,"Invalid IP address specified");
2745 return;
2746 }
2747
2748 /* Parameters are valid. Try to create the master instance. */
2749 ri = createSentinelRedisInstance(c->argv[2]->ptr,SRI_MASTER,
2750 c->argv[3]->ptr,port,quorum,NULL);
2751 if (ri == NULL) {
2752 switch(errno) {
2753 case EBUSY:
2754 addReplyError(c,"Duplicated master name");
2755 break;
2756 case EINVAL:
2757 addReplyError(c,"Invalid port number");
2758 break;
2759 default:
2760 addReplyError(c,"Unspecified error adding the instance");
2761 break;
2762 }
2763 } else {
2764 sentinelFlushConfig();
2765 sentinelEvent(REDIS_WARNING,"+monitor",ri,"%@ quorum %d",ri->quorum);
2766 addReply(c,shared.ok);
2767 }
2768 } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"remove")) {
2769 /* SENTINEL REMOVE <name> */
2770 sentinelRedisInstance *ri;
2771
2772 if ((ri = sentinelGetMasterByNameOrReplyError(c,c->argv[2]))
2773 == NULL) return;
2774 sentinelEvent(REDIS_WARNING,"-monitor",ri,"%@");
2775 dictDelete(sentinel.masters,c->argv[2]->ptr);
2776 sentinelFlushConfig();
2777 addReply(c,shared.ok);
2778 } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"set")) {
2779 if (c->argc < 3 || c->argc % 2 == 0) goto numargserr;
2780 sentinelSetCommand(c);
2781 } else {
2782 addReplyErrorFormat(c,"Unknown sentinel subcommand '%s'",
2783 (char*)c->argv[1]->ptr);
2784 }
2785 return;
2786
2787numargserr:
2788 addReplyErrorFormat(c,"Wrong number of arguments for 'sentinel %s'",
2789 (char*)c->argv[1]->ptr);
2790}
2791
2792/* SENTINEL INFO [section] */
2793void sentinelInfoCommand(redisClient *c) {
2794 char *section = c->argc == 2 ? c->argv[1]->ptr : "default";
2795 sds info = sdsempty();
2796 int defsections = !strcasecmp(section,"default");
2797 int sections = 0;
2798
2799 if (c->argc > 2) {
2800 addReply(c,shared.syntaxerr);
2801 return;
2802 }
2803
2804 if (!strcasecmp(section,"server") || defsections) {
2805 if (sections++) info = sdscat(info,"\r\n");
2806 sds serversection = genRedisInfoString("server");
2807 info = sdscatlen(info,serversection,sdslen(serversection));
2808 sdsfree(serversection);
2809 }
2810
2811 if (!strcasecmp(section,"sentinel") || defsections) {
2812 dictIterator *di;
2813 dictEntry *de;
2814 int master_id = 0;
2815
2816 if (sections++) info = sdscat(info,"\r\n");
2817 info = sdscatprintf(info,
2818 "# Sentinel\r\n"
2819 "sentinel_masters:%lu\r\n"
2820 "sentinel_tilt:%d\r\n"
2821 "sentinel_running_scripts:%d\r\n"
2822 "sentinel_scripts_queue_length:%ld\r\n",
2823 dictSize(sentinel.masters),
2824 sentinel.tilt,
2825 sentinel.running_scripts,
2826 listLength(sentinel.scripts_queue));
2827
2828 di = dictGetIterator(sentinel.masters);
2829 while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
2830 sentinelRedisInstance *ri = dictGetVal(de);
2831 char *status = "ok";
2832
2833 if (ri->flags & SRI_O_DOWN) status = "odown";
2834 else if (ri->flags & SRI_S_DOWN) status = "sdown";
2835 info = sdscatprintf(info,
2836 "master%d:name=%s,status=%s,address=%s:%d,"
2837 "slaves=%lu,sentinels=%lu\r\n",
2838 master_id++, ri->name, status,
2839 ri->addr->ip, ri->addr->port,
2840 dictSize(ri->slaves),
2841 dictSize(ri->sentinels)+1);
2842 }
2843 dictReleaseIterator(di);
2844 }
2845
2846 addReplySds(c,sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),"$%lu\r\n",
2847 (unsigned long)sdslen(info)));
2848 addReplySds(c,info);
2849 addReply(c,shared.crlf);
2850}
2851
2852/* Implements Sentinel verison of the ROLE command. The output is
2853 * "sentinel" and the list of currently monitored master names. */
2854void sentinelRoleCommand(redisClient *c) {
2855 dictIterator *di;
2856 dictEntry *de;
2857
2858 addReplyMultiBulkLen(c,2);
2859 addReplyBulkCBuffer(c,"sentinel",8);
2860 addReplyMultiBulkLen(c,dictSize(sentinel.masters));
2861
2862 di = dictGetIterator(sentinel.masters);
2863 while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
2864 sentinelRedisInstance *ri = dictGetVal(de);
2865
2866 addReplyBulkCString(c,ri->name);
2867 }
2868 dictReleaseIterator(di);
2869}
2870
2871/* SENTINEL SET <mastername> [<option> <value> ...] */
2872void sentinelSetCommand(redisClient *c) {
2873 sentinelRedisInstance *ri;
2874 int j, changes = 0;
2875 char *option, *value;
2876
2877 if ((ri = sentinelGetMasterByNameOrReplyError(c,c->argv[2]))
2878 == NULL) return;
2879
2880 /* Process option - value pairs. */
2881 for (j = 3; j < c->argc; j += 2) {
2882 option = c->argv[j]->ptr;
2883 value = c->argv[j+1]->ptr;
2884 robj *o = c->argv[j+1];
2885 long long ll;
2886
2887 if (!strcasecmp(option,"down-after-milliseconds")) {
2888 /* down-after-millisecodns <milliseconds> */
2889 if (getLongLongFromObject(o,&ll) == REDIS_ERR || ll <= 0)
2890 goto badfmt;
2891 ri->down_after_period = ll;
2892 sentinelPropagateDownAfterPeriod(ri);
2893 changes++;
2894 } else if (!strcasecmp(option,"failover-timeout")) {
2895 /* failover-timeout <milliseconds> */
2896 if (getLongLongFromObject(o,&ll) == REDIS_ERR || ll <= 0)
2897 goto badfmt;
2898 ri->failover_timeout = ll;
2899 changes++;
2900 } else if (!strcasecmp(option,"parallel-syncs")) {
2901 /* parallel-syncs <milliseconds> */
2902 if (getLongLongFromObject(o,&ll) == REDIS_ERR || ll <= 0)
2903 goto badfmt;
2904 ri->parallel_syncs = ll;
2905 changes++;
2906 } else if (!strcasecmp(option,"notification-script")) {
2907 /* notification-script <path> */
2908 if (strlen(value) && access(value,X_OK) == -1) {
2909 addReplyError(c,
2910 "Notification script seems non existing or non executable");
2911 if (changes) sentinelFlushConfig();
2912 return;
2913 }
2914 sdsfree(ri->notification_script);
2915 ri->notification_script = strlen(value) ? sdsnew(value) : NULL;
2916 changes++;
2917 } else if (!strcasecmp(option,"client-reconfig-script")) {
2918 /* client-reconfig-script <path> */
2919 if (strlen(value) && access(value,X_OK) == -1) {
2920 addReplyError(c,
2921 "Client reconfiguration script seems non existing or "
2922 "non executable");
2923 if (changes) sentinelFlushConfig();
2924 return;
2925 }
2926 sdsfree(ri->client_reconfig_script);
2927 ri->client_reconfig_script = strlen(value) ? sdsnew(value) : NULL;
2928 changes++;
2929 } else if (!strcasecmp(option,"auth-pass")) {
2930 /* auth-pass <password> */
2931 sdsfree(ri->auth_pass);
2932 ri->auth_pass = strlen(value) ? sdsnew(value) : NULL;
2933 changes++;
2934 } else if (!strcasecmp(option,"quorum")) {
2935 /* quorum <count> */
2936 if (getLongLongFromObject(o,&ll) == REDIS_ERR || ll <= 0)
2937 goto badfmt;
2938 ri->quorum = ll;
2939 changes++;
2940 } else {
2941 addReplyErrorFormat(c,"Unknown option '%s' for SENTINEL SET",
2942 option);
2943 if (changes) sentinelFlushConfig();
2944 return;
2945 }
2946 sentinelEvent(REDIS_WARNING,"+set",ri,"%@ %s %s",option,value);
2947 }
2948
2949 if (changes) sentinelFlushConfig();
2950 addReply(c,shared.ok);
2951 return;
2952
2953badfmt: /* Bad format errors */
2954 if (changes) sentinelFlushConfig();
2955 addReplyErrorFormat(c,"Invalid argument '%s' for SENTINEL SET '%s'",
2956 value, option);
2957}
2958
2959/* Our fake PUBLISH command: it is actually useful only to receive hello messages
2960 * from the other sentinel instances, and publishing to a channel other than
2961 * SENTINEL_HELLO_CHANNEL is forbidden.
2962 *
2963 * Because we have a Sentinel PUBLISH, the code to send hello messages is the same
2964 * for all the three kind of instances: masters, slaves, sentinels. */
2965void sentinelPublishCommand(redisClient *c) {
2966 if (strcmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,SENTINEL_HELLO_CHANNEL)) {
2967 addReplyError(c, "Only HELLO messages are accepted by Sentinel instances.");
2968 return;
2969 }
2970 sentinelProcessHelloMessage(c->argv[2]->ptr,sdslen(c->argv[2]->ptr));
2971 addReplyLongLong(c,1);
2972}
2973
2974/* ===================== SENTINEL availability checks ======================= */
2975
2976/* Is this instance down from our point of view? */
2977void sentinelCheckSubjectivelyDown(sentinelRedisInstance *ri) {
2978 mstime_t elapsed = 0;
2979
2980 if (ri->last_ping_time)
2981 elapsed = mstime() - ri->last_ping_time;
2982
2983 /* Check if we are in need for a reconnection of one of the
2984 * links, because we are detecting low activity.
2985 *
2986 * 1) Check if the command link seems connected, was connected not less
2987 * than SENTINEL_MIN_LINK_RECONNECT_PERIOD, but still we have a
2988 * pending ping for more than half the timeout. */
2989 if (ri->cc &&
2990 (mstime() - ri->cc_conn_time) > SENTINEL_MIN_LINK_RECONNECT_PERIOD &&
2991 ri->last_ping_time != 0 && /* Ther is a pending ping... */
2992 /* The pending ping is delayed, and we did not received
2993 * error replies as well. */
2994 (mstime() - ri->last_ping_time) > (ri->down_after_period/2) &&
2995 (mstime() - ri->last_pong_time) > (ri->down_after_period/2))
2996 {
2997 sentinelKillLink(ri,ri->cc);
2998 }
2999
3000 /* 2) Check if the pubsub link seems connected, was connected not less
3001 * than SENTINEL_MIN_LINK_RECONNECT_PERIOD, but still we have no
3002 * activity in the Pub/Sub channel for more than
3003 * SENTINEL_PUBLISH_PERIOD * 3.
3004 */
3005 if (ri->pc &&
3006 (mstime() - ri->pc_conn_time) > SENTINEL_MIN_LINK_RECONNECT_PERIOD &&
3007 (mstime() - ri->pc_last_activity) > (SENTINEL_PUBLISH_PERIOD*3))
3008 {
3009 sentinelKillLink(ri,ri->pc);
3010 }
3011
3012 /* Update the SDOWN flag. We believe the instance is SDOWN if:
3013 *
3014 * 1) It is not replying.
3015 * 2) We believe it is a master, it reports to be a slave for enough time
3016 * to meet the down_after_period, plus enough time to get two times
3017 * INFO report from the instance. */
3018 if (elapsed > ri->down_after_period ||
3019 (ri->flags & SRI_MASTER &&
3020 ri->role_reported == SRI_SLAVE &&
3021 mstime() - ri->role_reported_time >
3022 (ri->down_after_period+SENTINEL_INFO_PERIOD*2)))
3023 {
3024 /* Is subjectively down */
3025 if ((ri->flags & SRI_S_DOWN) == 0) {
3026 sentinelEvent(REDIS_WARNING,"+sdown",ri,"%@");
3027 ri->s_down_since_time = mstime();
3028 ri->flags |= SRI_S_DOWN;
3029 }
3030 } else {
3031 /* Is subjectively up */
3032 if (ri->flags & SRI_S_DOWN) {
3033 sentinelEvent(REDIS_WARNING,"-sdown",ri,"%@");
3034 ri->flags &= ~(SRI_S_DOWN|SRI_SCRIPT_KILL_SENT);
3035 }
3036 }
3037}
3038
3039/* Is this instance down according to the configured quorum?
3040 *
3041 * Note that ODOWN is a weak quorum, it only means that enough Sentinels
3042 * reported in a given time range that the instance was not reachable.
3043 * However messages can be delayed so there are no strong guarantees about
3044 * N instances agreeing at the same time about the down state. */
3045void sentinelCheckObjectivelyDown(sentinelRedisInstance *master) {
3046 dictIterator *di;
3047 dictEntry *de;
3048 unsigned int quorum = 0, odown = 0;
3049
3050 if (master->flags & SRI_S_DOWN) {
3051 /* Is down for enough sentinels? */
3052 quorum = 1; /* the current sentinel. */
3053 /* Count all the other sentinels. */
3054 di = dictGetIterator(master->sentinels);
3055 while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
3056 sentinelRedisInstance *ri = dictGetVal(de);
3057
3058 if (ri->flags & SRI_MASTER_DOWN) quorum++;
3059 }
3060 dictReleaseIterator(di);
3061 if (quorum >= master->quorum) odown = 1;
3062 }
3063
3064 /* Set the flag accordingly to the outcome. */
3065 if (odown) {
3066 if ((master->flags & SRI_O_DOWN) == 0) {
3067 sentinelEvent(REDIS_WARNING,"+odown",master,"%@ #quorum %d/%d",
3068 quorum, master->quorum);
3069 master->flags |= SRI_O_DOWN;
3070 master->o_down_since_time = mstime();
3071 }
3072 } else {
3073 if (master->flags & SRI_O_DOWN) {
3074 sentinelEvent(REDIS_WARNING,"-odown",master,"%@");
3075 master->flags &= ~SRI_O_DOWN;
3076 }
3077 }
3078}
3079
3080/* Receive the SENTINEL is-master-down-by-addr reply, see the
3081 * sentinelAskMasterStateToOtherSentinels() function for more information. */
3082void sentinelReceiveIsMasterDownReply(redisAsyncContext *c, void *reply, void *privdata) {
3083 sentinelRedisInstance *ri = c->data;
3084 redisReply *r;
3085 REDIS_NOTUSED(privdata);
3086
3087 if (ri) ri->pending_commands--;
3088 if (!reply || !ri) return;
3089 r = reply;
3090
3091 /* Ignore every error or unexpected reply.
3092 * Note that if the command returns an error for any reason we'll
3093 * end clearing the SRI_MASTER_DOWN flag for timeout anyway. */
3094 if (r->type == REDIS_REPLY_ARRAY && r->elements == 3 &&
3095 r->element[0]->type == REDIS_REPLY_INTEGER &&
3096 r->element[1]->type == REDIS_REPLY_STRING &&
3097 r->element[2]->type == REDIS_REPLY_INTEGER)
3098 {
3099 ri->last_master_down_reply_time = mstime();
3100 if (r->element[0]->integer == 1) {
3101 ri->flags |= SRI_MASTER_DOWN;
3102 } else {
3103 ri->flags &= ~SRI_MASTER_DOWN;
3104 }
3105 if (strcmp(r->element[1]->str,"*")) {
3106 /* If the runid in the reply is not "*" the Sentinel actually
3107 * replied with a vote. */
3108 sdsfree(ri->leader);
3109 if ((long long)ri->leader_epoch != r->element[2]->integer)
3110 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,
3111 "%s voted for %s %llu", ri->name,
3112 r->element[1]->str,
3113 (unsigned long long) r->element[2]->integer);
3114 ri->leader = sdsnew(r->element[1]->str);
3115 ri->leader_epoch = r->element[2]->integer;
3116 }
3117 }
3118}
3119
3120/* If we think the master is down, we start sending
3121 * SENTINEL IS-MASTER-DOWN-BY-ADDR requests to other sentinels
3122 * in order to get the replies that allow to reach the quorum
3123 * needed to mark the master in ODOWN state and trigger a failover. */
3124#define SENTINEL_ASK_FORCED (1<<0)
3125void sentinelAskMasterStateToOtherSentinels(sentinelRedisInstance *master, int flags) {
3126 dictIterator *di;
3127 dictEntry *de;
3128
3129 di = dictGetIterator(master->sentinels);
3130 while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
3131 sentinelRedisInstance *ri = dictGetVal(de);
3132 mstime_t elapsed = mstime() - ri->last_master_down_reply_time;
3133 char port[32];
3134 int retval;
3135
3136 /* If the master state from other sentinel is too old, we clear it. */
3137 if (elapsed > SENTINEL_ASK_PERIOD*5) {
3138 ri->flags &= ~SRI_MASTER_DOWN;
3139 sdsfree(ri->leader);
3140 ri->leader = NULL;
3141 }
3142
3143 /* Only ask if master is down to other sentinels if:
3144 *
3145 * 1) We believe it is down, or there is a failover in progress.
3146 * 2) Sentinel is connected.
3147 * 3) We did not received the info within SENTINEL_ASK_PERIOD ms. */
3148 if ((master->flags & SRI_S_DOWN) == 0) continue;
3149 if (ri->flags & SRI_DISCONNECTED) continue;
3150 if (!(flags & SENTINEL_ASK_FORCED) &&
3151 mstime() - ri->last_master_down_reply_time < SENTINEL_ASK_PERIOD)
3152 continue;
3153
3154 /* Ask */
3155 ll2string(port,sizeof(port),master->addr->port);
3156 retval = redisAsyncCommand(ri->cc,
3157 sentinelReceiveIsMasterDownReply, NULL,
3158 "SENTINEL is-master-down-by-addr %s %s %llu %s",
3159 master->addr->ip, port,
3160 sentinel.current_epoch,
3161 (master->failover_state > SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_NONE) ?
3162 server.runid : "*");
3163 if (retval == REDIS_OK) ri->pending_commands++;
3164 }
3165 dictReleaseIterator(di);
3166}
3167
3168/* =============================== FAILOVER ================================= */
3169
3170/* Vote for the sentinel with 'req_runid' or return the old vote if already
3171 * voted for the specifed 'req_epoch' or one greater.
3172 *
3173 * If a vote is not available returns NULL, otherwise return the Sentinel
3174 * runid and populate the leader_epoch with the epoch of the vote. */
3175char *sentinelVoteLeader(sentinelRedisInstance *master, uint64_t req_epoch, char *req_runid, uint64_t *leader_epoch) {
3176 if (req_epoch > sentinel.current_epoch) {
3177 sentinel.current_epoch = req_epoch;
3178 sentinelFlushConfig();
3179 sentinelEvent(REDIS_WARNING,"+new-epoch",master,"%llu",
3180 (unsigned long long) sentinel.current_epoch);
3181 }
3182
3183 if (master->leader_epoch < req_epoch && sentinel.current_epoch <= req_epoch)
3184 {
3185 sdsfree(master->leader);
3186 master->leader = sdsnew(req_runid);
3187 master->leader_epoch = sentinel.current_epoch;
3188 sentinelFlushConfig();
3189 sentinelEvent(REDIS_WARNING,"+vote-for-leader",master,"%s %llu",
3190 master->leader, (unsigned long long) master->leader_epoch);
3191 /* If we did not voted for ourselves, set the master failover start
3192 * time to now, in order to force a delay before we can start a
3193 * failover for the same master. */
3194 if (strcasecmp(master->leader,server.runid))
3195 master->failover_start_time = mstime()+rand()%SENTINEL_MAX_DESYNC;
3196 }
3197
3198 *leader_epoch = master->leader_epoch;
3199 return master->leader ? sdsnew(master->leader) : NULL;
3200}
3201
3202struct sentinelLeader {
3203 char *runid;
3204 unsigned long votes;
3205};
3206
3207/* Helper function for sentinelGetLeader, increment the counter
3208 * relative to the specified runid. */
3209int sentinelLeaderIncr(dict *counters, char *runid) {
3210 dictEntry *de = dictFind(counters,runid);
3211 uint64_t oldval;
3212
3213 if (de) {
3214 oldval = dictGetUnsignedIntegerVal(de);
3215 dictSetUnsignedIntegerVal(de,oldval+1);
3216 return oldval+1;
3217 } else {
3218 de = dictAddRaw(counters,runid);
3219 redisAssert(de != NULL);
3220 dictSetUnsignedIntegerVal(de,1);
3221 return 1;
3222 }
3223}
3224
3225/* Scan all the Sentinels attached to this master to check if there
3226 * is a leader for the specified epoch.
3227 *
3228 * To be a leader for a given epoch, we should have the majority of
3229 * the Sentinels we know (ever seen since the last SENTINEL RESET) that
3230 * reported the same instance as leader for the same epoch. */
3231char *sentinelGetLeader(sentinelRedisInstance *master, uint64_t epoch) {
3232 dict *counters;
3233 dictIterator *di;
3234 dictEntry *de;
3235 unsigned int voters = 0, voters_quorum;
3236 char *myvote;
3237 char *winner = NULL;
3238 uint64_t leader_epoch;
3239 uint64_t max_votes = 0;
3240
3241 redisAssert(master->flags & (SRI_O_DOWN|SRI_FAILOVER_IN_PROGRESS));
3242 counters = dictCreate(&leaderVotesDictType,NULL);
3243
3244 voters = dictSize(master->sentinels)+1; /* All the other sentinels and me. */
3245
3246 /* Count other sentinels votes */
3247 di = dictGetIterator(master->sentinels);
3248 while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
3249 sentinelRedisInstance *ri = dictGetVal(de);
3250 if (ri->leader != NULL && ri->leader_epoch == sentinel.current_epoch)
3251 sentinelLeaderIncr(counters,ri->leader);
3252 }
3253 dictReleaseIterator(di);
3254
3255 /* Check what's the winner. For the winner to win, it needs two conditions:
3256 * 1) Absolute majority between voters (50% + 1).
3257 * 2) And anyway at least master->quorum votes. */
3258 di = dictGetIterator(counters);
3259 while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
3260 uint64_t votes = dictGetUnsignedIntegerVal(de);
3261
3262 if (votes > max_votes) {
3263 max_votes = votes;
3264 winner = dictGetKey(de);
3265 }
3266 }
3267 dictReleaseIterator(di);
3268
3269 /* Count this Sentinel vote:
3270 * if this Sentinel did not voted yet, either vote for the most
3271 * common voted sentinel, or for itself if no vote exists at all. */
3272 if (winner)
3273 myvote = sentinelVoteLeader(master,epoch,winner,&leader_epoch);
3274 else
3275 myvote = sentinelVoteLeader(master,epoch,server.runid,&leader_epoch);
3276
3277 if (myvote && leader_epoch == epoch) {
3278 uint64_t votes = sentinelLeaderIncr(counters,myvote);
3279
3280 if (votes > max_votes) {
3281 max_votes = votes;
3282 winner = myvote;
3283 }
3284 }
3285
3286 voters_quorum = voters/2+1;
3287 if (winner && (max_votes < voters_quorum || max_votes < master->quorum))
3288 winner = NULL;
3289
3290 winner = winner ? sdsnew(winner) : NULL;
3291 sdsfree(myvote);
3292 dictRelease(counters);
3293 return winner;
3294}
3295
3296/* Send SLAVEOF to the specified instance, always followed by a
3297 * CONFIG REWRITE command in order to store the new configuration on disk
3298 * when possible (that is, if the Redis instance is recent enough to support
3299 * config rewriting, and if the server was started with a configuration file).
3300 *
3301 * If Host is NULL the function sends "SLAVEOF NO ONE".
3302 *
3303 * The command returns REDIS_OK if the SLAVEOF command was accepted for
3304 * (later) delivery otherwise REDIS_ERR. The command replies are just
3305 * discarded. */
3306int sentinelSendSlaveOf(sentinelRedisInstance *ri, char *host, int port) {
3307 char portstr[32];
3308 int retval;
3309
3310 ll2string(portstr,sizeof(portstr),port);
3311
3312 /* If host is NULL we send SLAVEOF NO ONE that will turn the instance
3313 * into a master. */
3314 if (host == NULL) {
3315 host = "NO";
3316 memcpy(portstr,"ONE",4);
3317 }
3318
3319 /* In order to send SLAVEOF in a safe way, we send a transaction performing
3320 * the following tasks:
3321 * 1) Reconfigure the instance according to the specified host/port params.
3322 * 2) Rewrite the configuraiton.
3323 * 3) Disconnect all clients (but this one sending the commnad) in order
3324 * to trigger the ask-master-on-reconnection protocol for connected
3325 * clients.
3326 *
3327 * Note that we don't check the replies returned by commands, since we
3328 * will observe instead the effects in the next INFO output. */
3329 retval = redisAsyncCommand(ri->cc,
3330 sentinelDiscardReplyCallback, NULL, "MULTI");
3331 if (retval == REDIS_ERR) return retval;
3332 ri->pending_commands++;
3333
3334 retval = redisAsyncCommand(ri->cc,
3335 sentinelDiscardReplyCallback, NULL, "SLAVEOF %s %s", host, portstr);
3336 if (retval == REDIS_ERR) return retval;
3337 ri->pending_commands++;
3338
3339 retval = redisAsyncCommand(ri->cc,
3340 sentinelDiscardReplyCallback, NULL, "CONFIG REWRITE");
3341 if (retval == REDIS_ERR) return retval;
3342 ri->pending_commands++;
3343
3344 /* CLIENT KILL TYPE <type> is only supported starting from Redis 2.8.12,
3345 * however sending it to an instance not understanding this command is not
3346 * an issue because CLIENT is variadic command, so Redis will not
3347 * recognized as a syntax error, and the transaction will not fail (but
3348 * only the unsupported command will fail). */
3349 retval = redisAsyncCommand(ri->cc,
3350 sentinelDiscardReplyCallback, NULL, "CLIENT KILL TYPE normal");
3351 if (retval == REDIS_ERR) return retval;
3352 ri->pending_commands++;
3353
3354 retval = redisAsyncCommand(ri->cc,
3355 sentinelDiscardReplyCallback, NULL, "EXEC");
3356 if (retval == REDIS_ERR) return retval;
3357 ri->pending_commands++;
3358
3359 return REDIS_OK;
3360}
3361
3362/* Setup the master state to start a failover. */
3363void sentinelStartFailover(sentinelRedisInstance *master) {
3364 redisAssert(master->flags & SRI_MASTER);
3365
3366 master->failover_state = SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_WAIT_START;
3367 master->flags |= SRI_FAILOVER_IN_PROGRESS;
3368 master->failover_epoch = ++sentinel.current_epoch;
3369 sentinelEvent(REDIS_WARNING,"+new-epoch",master,"%llu",
3370 (unsigned long long) sentinel.current_epoch);
3371 sentinelEvent(REDIS_WARNING,"+try-failover",master,"%@");
3372 master->failover_start_time = mstime()+rand()%SENTINEL_MAX_DESYNC;
3373 master->failover_state_change_time = mstime();
3374}
3375
3376/* This function checks if there are the conditions to start the failover,
3377 * that is:
3378 *
3379 * 1) Master must be in ODOWN condition.
3380 * 2) No failover already in progress.
3381 * 3) No failover already attempted recently.
3382 *
3383 * We still don't know if we'll win the election so it is possible that we
3384 * start the failover but that we'll not be able to act.
3385 *
3386 * Return non-zero if a failover was started. */
3387int sentinelStartFailoverIfNeeded(sentinelRedisInstance *master) {
3388 /* We can't failover if the master is not in O_DOWN state. */
3389 if (!(master->flags & SRI_O_DOWN)) return 0;
3390
3391 /* Failover already in progress? */
3392 if (master->flags & SRI_FAILOVER_IN_PROGRESS) return 0;
3393
3394 /* Last failover attempt started too little time ago? */
3395 if (mstime() - master->failover_start_time <
3396 master->failover_timeout*2)
3397 {
3398 if (master->failover_delay_logged != master->failover_start_time) {
3399 time_t clock = (master->failover_start_time +
3400 master->failover_timeout*2) / 1000;
3401 char ctimebuf[26];
3402
3403 ctime_r(&clock,ctimebuf);
3404 ctimebuf[24] = '\0'; /* Remove newline. */
3405 master->failover_delay_logged = master->failover_start_time;
3406 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,
3407 "Next failover delay: I will not start a failover before %s",
3408 ctimebuf);
3409 }
3410 return 0;
3411 }
3412
3413 sentinelStartFailover(master);
3414 return 1;
3415}
3416
3417/* Select a suitable slave to promote. The current algorithm only uses
3418 * the following parameters:
3419 *
3420 * 1) None of the following conditions: S_DOWN, O_DOWN, DISCONNECTED.
3421 * 2) Last time the slave replied to ping no more than 5 times the PING period.
3422 * 3) info_refresh not older than 3 times the INFO refresh period.
3423 * 4) master_link_down_time no more than:
3424 * (now - master->s_down_since_time) + (master->down_after_period * 10).
3425 * Basically since the master is down from our POV, the slave reports
3426 * to be disconnected no more than 10 times the configured down-after-period.
3427 * This is pretty much black magic but the idea is, the master was not
3428 * available so the slave may be lagging, but not over a certain time.
3429 * Anyway we'll select the best slave according to replication offset.
3430 * 5) Slave priority can't be zero, otherwise the slave is discarded.
3431 *
3432 * Among all the slaves matching the above conditions we select the slave
3433 * with, in order of sorting key:
3434 *
3435 * - lower slave_priority.
3436 * - bigger processed replication offset.
3437 * - lexicographically smaller runid.
3438 *
3439 * Basically if runid is the same, the slave that processed more commands
3440 * from the master is selected.
3441 *
3442 * The function returns the pointer to the selected slave, otherwise
3443 * NULL if no suitable slave was found.
3444 */
3445
3446/* Helper for sentinelSelectSlave(). This is used by qsort() in order to
3447 * sort suitable slaves in a "better first" order, to take the first of
3448 * the list. */
3449int compareSlavesForPromotion(const void *a, const void *b) {
3450 sentinelRedisInstance **sa = (sentinelRedisInstance **)a,
3451 **sb = (sentinelRedisInstance **)b;
3452 char *sa_runid, *sb_runid;
3453
3454 if ((*sa)->slave_priority != (*sb)->slave_priority)
3455 return (*sa)->slave_priority - (*sb)->slave_priority;
3456
3457 /* If priority is the same, select the slave with greater replication
3458 * offset (processed more data frmo the master). */
3459 if ((*sa)->slave_repl_offset > (*sb)->slave_repl_offset) {
3460 return -1; /* a < b */
3461 } else if ((*sa)->slave_repl_offset < (*sb)->slave_repl_offset) {
3462 return 1; /* b > a */
3463 }
3464
3465 /* If the replication offset is the same select the slave with that has
3466 * the lexicographically smaller runid. Note that we try to handle runid
3467 * == NULL as there are old Redis versions that don't publish runid in
3468 * INFO. A NULL runid is considered bigger than any other runid. */
3469 sa_runid = (*sa)->runid;
3470 sb_runid = (*sb)->runid;
3471 if (sa_runid == NULL && sb_runid == NULL) return 0;
3472 else if (sa_runid == NULL) return 1; /* a > b */
3473 else if (sb_runid == NULL) return -1; /* a < b */
3474 return strcasecmp(sa_runid, sb_runid);
3475}
3476
3477sentinelRedisInstance *sentinelSelectSlave(sentinelRedisInstance *master) {
3478 sentinelRedisInstance **instance =
3479 zmalloc(sizeof(instance[0])*dictSize(master->slaves));
3480 sentinelRedisInstance *selected = NULL;
3481 int instances = 0;
3482 dictIterator *di;
3483 dictEntry *de;
3484 mstime_t max_master_down_time = 0;
3485
3486 if (master->flags & SRI_S_DOWN)
3487 max_master_down_time += mstime() - master->s_down_since_time;
3488 max_master_down_time += master->down_after_period * 10;
3489
3490 di = dictGetIterator(master->slaves);
3491 while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
3492 sentinelRedisInstance *slave = dictGetVal(de);
3493 mstime_t info_validity_time;
3494
3495 if (slave->flags & (SRI_S_DOWN|SRI_O_DOWN|SRI_DISCONNECTED)) continue;
3496 if (mstime() - slave->last_avail_time > SENTINEL_PING_PERIOD*5) continue;
3497 if (slave->slave_priority == 0) continue;
3498
3499 /* If the master is in SDOWN state we get INFO for slaves every second.
3500 * Otherwise we get it with the usual period so we need to account for
3501 * a larger delay. */
3502 if (master->flags & SRI_S_DOWN)
3503 info_validity_time = SENTINEL_PING_PERIOD*5;
3504 else
3505 info_validity_time = SENTINEL_INFO_PERIOD*3;
3506 if (mstime() - slave->info_refresh > info_validity_time) continue;
3507 if (slave->master_link_down_time > max_master_down_time) continue;
3508 instance[instances++] = slave;
3509 }
3510 dictReleaseIterator(di);
3511 if (instances) {
3512 qsort(instance,instances,sizeof(sentinelRedisInstance*),
3513 compareSlavesForPromotion);
3514 selected = instance[0];
3515 }
3516 zfree(instance);
3517 return selected;
3518}
3519
3520/* ---------------- Failover state machine implementation ------------------- */
3521void sentinelFailoverWaitStart(sentinelRedisInstance *ri) {
3522 char *leader;
3523 int isleader;
3524
3525 /* Check if we are the leader for the failover epoch. */
3526 leader = sentinelGetLeader(ri, ri->failover_epoch);
3527 isleader = leader && strcasecmp(leader,server.runid) == 0;
3528 sdsfree(leader);
3529
3530 /* If I'm not the leader, and it is not a forced failover via
3531 * SENTINEL FAILOVER, then I can't continue with the failover. */
3532 if (!isleader && !(ri->flags & SRI_FORCE_FAILOVER)) {
3533 int election_timeout = SENTINEL_ELECTION_TIMEOUT;
3534
3535 /* The election timeout is the MIN between SENTINEL_ELECTION_TIMEOUT
3536 * and the configured failover timeout. */
3537 if (election_timeout > ri->failover_timeout)
3538 election_timeout = ri->failover_timeout;
3539 /* Abort the failover if I'm not the leader after some time. */
3540 if (mstime() - ri->failover_start_time > election_timeout) {
3541 sentinelEvent(REDIS_WARNING,"-failover-abort-not-elected",ri,"%@");
3542 sentinelAbortFailover(ri);
3543 }
3544 return;
3545 }
3546 sentinelEvent(REDIS_WARNING,"+elected-leader",ri,"%@");
3547 ri->failover_state = SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_SELECT_SLAVE;
3548 ri->failover_state_change_time = mstime();
3549 sentinelEvent(REDIS_WARNING,"+failover-state-select-slave",ri,"%@");
3550}
3551
3552void sentinelFailoverSelectSlave(sentinelRedisInstance *ri) {
3553 sentinelRedisInstance *slave = sentinelSelectSlave(ri);
3554
3555 /* We don't handle the timeout in this state as the function aborts
3556 * the failover or go forward in the next state. */
3557 if (slave == NULL) {
3558 sentinelEvent(REDIS_WARNING,"-failover-abort-no-good-slave",ri,"%@");
3559 sentinelAbortFailover(ri);
3560 } else {
3561 sentinelEvent(REDIS_WARNING,"+selected-slave",slave,"%@");
3562 slave->flags |= SRI_PROMOTED;
3563 ri->promoted_slave = slave;
3564 ri->failover_state = SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_SEND_SLAVEOF_NOONE;
3565 ri->failover_state_change_time = mstime();
3566 sentinelEvent(REDIS_NOTICE,"+failover-state-send-slaveof-noone",
3567 slave, "%@");
3568 }
3569}
3570
3571void sentinelFailoverSendSlaveOfNoOne(sentinelRedisInstance *ri) {
3572 int retval;
3573
3574 /* We can't send the command to the promoted slave if it is now
3575 * disconnected. Retry again and again with this state until the timeout
3576 * is reached, then abort the failover. */
3577 if (ri->promoted_slave->flags & SRI_DISCONNECTED) {
3578 if (mstime() - ri->failover_state_change_time > ri->failover_timeout) {
3579 sentinelEvent(REDIS_WARNING,"-failover-abort-slave-timeout",ri,"%@");
3580 sentinelAbortFailover(ri);
3581 }
3582 return;
3583 }
3584
3585 /* Send SLAVEOF NO ONE command to turn the slave into a master.
3586 * We actually register a generic callback for this command as we don't
3587 * really care about the reply. We check if it worked indirectly observing
3588 * if INFO returns a different role (master instead of slave). */
3589 retval = sentinelSendSlaveOf(ri->promoted_slave,NULL,0);
3590 if (retval != REDIS_OK) return;
3591 sentinelEvent(REDIS_NOTICE, "+failover-state-wait-promotion",
3592 ri->promoted_slave,"%@");
3593 ri->failover_state = SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_WAIT_PROMOTION;
3594 ri->failover_state_change_time = mstime();
3595}
3596
3597/* We actually wait for promotion indirectly checking with INFO when the
3598 * slave turns into a master. */
3599void sentinelFailoverWaitPromotion(sentinelRedisInstance *ri) {
3600 /* Just handle the timeout. Switching to the next state is handled
3601 * by the function parsing the INFO command of the promoted slave. */
3602 if (mstime() - ri->failover_state_change_time > ri->failover_timeout) {
3603 sentinelEvent(REDIS_WARNING,"-failover-abort-slave-timeout",ri,"%@");
3604 sentinelAbortFailover(ri);
3605 }
3606}
3607
3608void sentinelFailoverDetectEnd(sentinelRedisInstance *master) {
3609 int not_reconfigured = 0, timeout = 0;
3610 dictIterator *di;
3611 dictEntry *de;
3612 mstime_t elapsed = mstime() - master->failover_state_change_time;
3613
3614 /* We can't consider failover finished if the promoted slave is
3615 * not reachable. */
3616 if (master->promoted_slave == NULL ||
3617 master->promoted_slave->flags & SRI_S_DOWN) return;
3618
3619 /* The failover terminates once all the reachable slaves are properly
3620 * configured. */
3621 di = dictGetIterator(master->slaves);
3622 while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
3623 sentinelRedisInstance *slave = dictGetVal(de);
3624
3625 if (slave->flags & (SRI_PROMOTED|SRI_RECONF_DONE)) continue;
3626 if (slave->flags & SRI_S_DOWN) continue;
3627 not_reconfigured++;
3628 }
3629 dictReleaseIterator(di);
3630
3631 /* Force end of failover on timeout. */
3632 if (elapsed > master->failover_timeout) {
3633 not_reconfigured = 0;
3634 timeout = 1;
3635 sentinelEvent(REDIS_WARNING,"+failover-end-for-timeout",master,"%@");
3636 }
3637
3638 if (not_reconfigured == 0) {
3639 sentinelEvent(REDIS_WARNING,"+failover-end",master,"%@");
3640 master->failover_state = SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_UPDATE_CONFIG;
3641 master->failover_state_change_time = mstime();
3642 }
3643
3644 /* If I'm the leader it is a good idea to send a best effort SLAVEOF
3645 * command to all the slaves still not reconfigured to replicate with
3646 * the new master. */
3647 if (timeout) {
3648 dictIterator *di;
3649 dictEntry *de;
3650
3651 di = dictGetIterator(master->slaves);
3652 while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
3653 sentinelRedisInstance *slave = dictGetVal(de);
3654 int retval;
3655
3656 if (slave->flags &
3657 (SRI_RECONF_DONE|SRI_RECONF_SENT|SRI_DISCONNECTED)) continue;
3658
3659 retval = sentinelSendSlaveOf(slave,
3660 master->promoted_slave->addr->ip,
3661 master->promoted_slave->addr->port);
3662 if (retval == REDIS_OK) {
3663 sentinelEvent(REDIS_NOTICE,"+slave-reconf-sent-be",slave,"%@");
3664 slave->flags |= SRI_RECONF_SENT;
3665 }
3666 }
3667 dictReleaseIterator(di);
3668 }
3669}
3670
3671/* Send SLAVE OF <new master address> to all the remaining slaves that
3672 * still don't appear to have the configuration updated. */
3673void sentinelFailoverReconfNextSlave(sentinelRedisInstance *master) {
3674 dictIterator *di;
3675 dictEntry *de;
3676 int in_progress = 0;
3677
3678 di = dictGetIterator(master->slaves);
3679 while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
3680 sentinelRedisInstance *slave = dictGetVal(de);
3681
3682 if (slave->flags & (SRI_RECONF_SENT|SRI_RECONF_INPROG))
3683 in_progress++;
3684 }
3685 dictReleaseIterator(di);
3686
3687 di = dictGetIterator(master->slaves);
3688 while(in_progress < master->parallel_syncs &&
3689 (de = dictNext(di)) != NULL)
3690 {
3691 sentinelRedisInstance *slave = dictGetVal(de);
3692 int retval;
3693
3694 /* Skip the promoted slave, and already configured slaves. */
3695 if (slave->flags & (SRI_PROMOTED|SRI_RECONF_DONE)) continue;
3696
3697 /* If too much time elapsed without the slave moving forward to
3698 * the next state, consider it reconfigured even if it is not.
3699 * Sentinels will detect the slave as misconfigured and fix its
3700 * configuration later. */
3701 if ((slave->flags & SRI_RECONF_SENT) &&
3702 (mstime() - slave->slave_reconf_sent_time) >
3703 SENTINEL_SLAVE_RECONF_TIMEOUT)
3704 {
3705 sentinelEvent(REDIS_NOTICE,"-slave-reconf-sent-timeout",slave,"%@");
3706 slave->flags &= ~SRI_RECONF_SENT;
3707 slave->flags |= SRI_RECONF_DONE;
3708 }
3709
3710 /* Nothing to do for instances that are disconnected or already
3711 * in RECONF_SENT state. */
3712 if (slave->flags & (SRI_DISCONNECTED|SRI_RECONF_SENT|SRI_RECONF_INPROG))
3713 continue;
3714
3715 /* Send SLAVEOF <new master>. */
3716 retval = sentinelSendSlaveOf(slave,
3717 master->promoted_slave->addr->ip,
3718 master->promoted_slave->addr->port);
3719 if (retval == REDIS_OK) {
3720 slave->flags |= SRI_RECONF_SENT;
3721 slave->slave_reconf_sent_time = mstime();
3722 sentinelEvent(REDIS_NOTICE,"+slave-reconf-sent",slave,"%@");
3723 in_progress++;
3724 }
3725 }
3726 dictReleaseIterator(di);
3727
3728 /* Check if all the slaves are reconfigured and handle timeout. */
3729 sentinelFailoverDetectEnd(master);
3730}
3731
3732/* This function is called when the slave is in
3733 * SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_UPDATE_CONFIG state. In this state we need
3734 * to remove it from the master table and add the promoted slave instead. */
3735void sentinelFailoverSwitchToPromotedSlave(sentinelRedisInstance *master) {
3736 sentinelRedisInstance *ref = master->promoted_slave ?
3737 master->promoted_slave : master;
3738
3739 sentinelEvent(REDIS_WARNING,"+switch-master",master,"%s %s %d %s %d",
3740 master->name, master->addr->ip, master->addr->port,
3741 ref->addr->ip, ref->addr->port);
3742
3743 sentinelResetMasterAndChangeAddress(master,ref->addr->ip,ref->addr->port);
3744}
3745
3746void sentinelFailoverStateMachine(sentinelRedisInstance *ri) {
3747 redisAssert(ri->flags & SRI_MASTER);
3748
3749 if (!(ri->flags & SRI_FAILOVER_IN_PROGRESS)) return;
3750
3751 switch(ri->failover_state) {
3752 case SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_WAIT_START:
3753 sentinelFailoverWaitStart(ri);
3754 break;
3755 case SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_SELECT_SLAVE:
3756 sentinelFailoverSelectSlave(ri);
3757 break;
3758 case SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_SEND_SLAVEOF_NOONE:
3759 sentinelFailoverSendSlaveOfNoOne(ri);
3760 break;
3761 case SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_WAIT_PROMOTION:
3762 sentinelFailoverWaitPromotion(ri);
3763 break;
3764 case SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_RECONF_SLAVES:
3765 sentinelFailoverReconfNextSlave(ri);
3766 break;
3767 }
3768}
3769
3770/* Abort a failover in progress:
3771 *
3772 * This function can only be called before the promoted slave acknowledged
3773 * the slave -> master switch. Otherwise the failover can't be aborted and
3774 * will reach its end (possibly by timeout). */
3775void sentinelAbortFailover(sentinelRedisInstance *ri) {
3776 redisAssert(ri->flags & SRI_FAILOVER_IN_PROGRESS);
3777 redisAssert(ri->failover_state <= SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_WAIT_PROMOTION);
3778
3779 ri->flags &= ~(SRI_FAILOVER_IN_PROGRESS|SRI_FORCE_FAILOVER);
3780 ri->failover_state = SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_NONE;
3781 ri->failover_state_change_time = mstime();
3782 if (ri->promoted_slave) {
3783 ri->promoted_slave->flags &= ~SRI_PROMOTED;
3784 ri->promoted_slave = NULL;
3785 }
3786}
3787
3788/* ======================== SENTINEL timer handler ==========================
3789 * This is the "main" our Sentinel, being sentinel completely non blocking
3790 * in design. The function is called every second.
3791 * -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3792
3793/* Perform scheduled operations for the specified Redis instance. */
3794void sentinelHandleRedisInstance(sentinelRedisInstance *ri) {
3795 /* ========== MONITORING HALF ============ */
3796 /* Every kind of instance */
3797 sentinelReconnectInstance(ri);
3798 sentinelSendPeriodicCommands(ri);
3799
3800 /* ============== ACTING HALF ============= */
3801 /* We don't proceed with the acting half if we are in TILT mode.
3802 * TILT happens when we find something odd with the time, like a
3803 * sudden change in the clock. */
3804 if (sentinel.tilt) {
3805 if (mstime()-sentinel.tilt_start_time < SENTINEL_TILT_PERIOD) return;
3806 sentinel.tilt = 0;
3807 sentinelEvent(REDIS_WARNING,"-tilt",NULL,"#tilt mode exited");
3808 }
3809
3810 /* Every kind of instance */
3811 sentinelCheckSubjectivelyDown(ri);
3812
3813 /* Masters and slaves */
3814 if (ri->flags & (SRI_MASTER|SRI_SLAVE)) {
3815 /* Nothing so far. */
3816 }
3817
3818 /* Only masters */
3819 if (ri->flags & SRI_MASTER) {
3820 sentinelCheckObjectivelyDown(ri);
3821 if (sentinelStartFailoverIfNeeded(ri))
3822 sentinelAskMasterStateToOtherSentinels(ri,SENTINEL_ASK_FORCED);
3823 sentinelFailoverStateMachine(ri);
3824 sentinelAskMasterStateToOtherSentinels(ri,SENTINEL_NO_FLAGS);
3825 }
3826}
3827
3828/* Perform scheduled operations for all the instances in the dictionary.
3829 * Recursively call the function against dictionaries of slaves. */
3830void sentinelHandleDictOfRedisInstances(dict *instances) {
3831 dictIterator *di;
3832 dictEntry *de;
3833 sentinelRedisInstance *switch_to_promoted = NULL;
3834
3835 /* There are a number of things we need to perform against every master. */
3836 di = dictGetIterator(instances);
3837 while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
3838 sentinelRedisInstance *ri = dictGetVal(de);
3839
3840 sentinelHandleRedisInstance(ri);
3841 if (ri->flags & SRI_MASTER) {
3842 sentinelHandleDictOfRedisInstances(ri->slaves);
3843 sentinelHandleDictOfRedisInstances(ri->sentinels);
3844 if (ri->failover_state == SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_UPDATE_CONFIG) {
3845 switch_to_promoted = ri;
3846 }
3847 }
3848 }
3849 if (switch_to_promoted)
3850 sentinelFailoverSwitchToPromotedSlave(switch_to_promoted);
3851 dictReleaseIterator(di);
3852}
3853
3854/* This function checks if we need to enter the TITL mode.
3855 *
3856 * The TILT mode is entered if we detect that between two invocations of the
3857 * timer interrupt, a negative amount of time, or too much time has passed.
3858 * Note that we expect that more or less just 100 milliseconds will pass
3859 * if everything is fine. However we'll see a negative number or a
3860 * difference bigger than SENTINEL_TILT_TRIGGER milliseconds if one of the
3861 * following conditions happen:
3862 *
3863 * 1) The Sentiel process for some time is blocked, for every kind of
3864 * random reason: the load is huge, the computer was frozen for some time
3865 * in I/O or alike, the process was stopped by a signal. Everything.
3866 * 2) The system clock was altered significantly.
3867 *
3868 * Under both this conditions we'll see everything as timed out and failing
3869 * without good reasons. Instead we enter the TILT mode and wait
3870 * for SENTINEL_TILT_PERIOD to elapse before starting to act again.
3871 *
3872 * During TILT time we still collect information, we just do not act. */
3873void sentinelCheckTiltCondition(void) {
3874 mstime_t now = mstime();
3875 mstime_t delta = now - sentinel.previous_time;
3876
3877 if (delta < 0 || delta > SENTINEL_TILT_TRIGGER) {
3878 sentinel.tilt = 1;
3879 sentinel.tilt_start_time = mstime();
3880 sentinelEvent(REDIS_WARNING,"+tilt",NULL,"#tilt mode entered");
3881 }
3882 sentinel.previous_time = mstime();
3883}
3884
3885void sentinelTimer(void) {
3886 sentinelCheckTiltCondition();
3887 sentinelHandleDictOfRedisInstances(sentinel.masters);
3888 sentinelRunPendingScripts();
3889 sentinelCollectTerminatedScripts();
3890 sentinelKillTimedoutScripts();
3891
3892 /* We continuously change the frequency of the Redis "timer interrupt"
3893 * in order to desynchronize every Sentinel from every other.
3894 * This non-determinism avoids that Sentinels started at the same time
3895 * exactly continue to stay synchronized asking to be voted at the
3896 * same time again and again (resulting in nobody likely winning the
3897 * election because of split brain voting). */
3898 server.hz = REDIS_DEFAULT_HZ + rand() % REDIS_DEFAULT_HZ;
3899}
